reviewText:
1. The game starts off with a single pioneer. You are basically forced to Primal Eden at gun point to help the Expansion Galaxies eradicate dinosaurs on the planet. If you die your close relatives volunteer to pick up where you left off.
2. Once on the planet for the first time you have nothing more then a machete, settlers mate and clothes with no camo value at all. The game is an open world first person shooter. You can find weapons or buy them if your a high enough rank.
3. When you kill one of the  five dinosaurs on the planet. You use your settlers mate to harvest it. There are rare dinosaurs aswell that drop special weapons that is later purchasable through the In game market when you die. From the harvests you gain G that is used to purchase these weapons and equipment.
4. There is these settlements throughout Primal Eden that offer crates of weapons, equipment and ammo. Certain settlements offer special weapons that are extremely expensive in the in game market. Like the .50 cal rifle that is only found in one location and only spawns one  per server.
5. Hosting a game is a bit difficult to setup. The game has a fare amount of bugs. You will have to open ports 42303 and 27015 in order to host. The game has no dedicated servers and what this means is your PC will become a server basically. You may still get the port error code message even if your ports are forwarded correctly. Your game may crash with other errors aswell.
6. If your into open world  survival horror first person shooters where you can hunt dinosaurs or other players? Then I highly recommend this game. It has its fare share of bugs, but the games direction is something unique and different

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hunt - Explore - Survive. This 3 things are very important in game.

For hunting you never musn't run because some on dinosaurs can hear you and attack you from behind. So all you need to is just to walk and you will come to place to place. At begging you start with bow and pda. For searching new weapons you need to find camps, there will be items or not, better items you have faster and more damage you will give. After you die you will lose the items you found and you will start again with bow and pda so be careful of dinosaurs and big hills. The map is huge. You need to spend pretty much hours to go everywhere.

If you want to survive you don't need to run always move and when you see dino try to avoid him or attack him if is not so dangerous... You need to go away from some plants that can steal your health or kill, avoid big hills because you can die if is a rock mountain.

Some of Dinosaurs are not dangerous... But for reward is good to kill them....

Game is really awesome hunting game i ever play...  You can even play with your friends and hunting together!

10/10!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Day 4.

Still hiding in the foliage, with 2 buckshot left.
T Rex is out there somewhere, I can hear it... stomping around.
Surrounded by Raptors, and If they find me, I will have to start shooting, but the T Rex will hear the shots...
Just gotta wait it out a little bit longer...
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you're a fan of stealth mixed with survival / scavenging, then this game is perfect for you. T Rex's are perhaps the most terrifying thing you will ever try to run, hide, or even fight, as even hiding silently they can randomly find you within dense foliage, or inside a hollow tree trunk.

There are a few problems with the inventory such as 1 buckshot round can take up the same amount of space as 5 buckshot rounds for example. It's like ammo is sorted out into individual groups, and once you run out of shots in an ammo group"
date: then you have to go into your inventory and place new group into the active slot
recommended: which would be tedious during a big fight.\n\nThe game is very slow paced
hoursPlayed: as the player must allways take care when traveling from outpost to outpost. Sprinting randomly while traveling can leave the player in dire situations. I haven't been able to play multiplayer yet

reviewText:
This game had so much potential, and started off on the right game, but the studio once again decided to turn a good idea into a way to make as much money as they can and then forget about it.
This game should not have left early access for at least another year, there are still plenty of glitches, the game is missing any major content.  Right now its walking simulator with 4 different species of dinos, a couple guns, and an uninteresting map.  While the Animations and sounds for the dinos are pretty nice, the ai really does not come down to much more than basic pathfinding and randoms on whether or not they'll pick you up when your near.

At most this only has 5 or 6 hours of gameplay if your lucky, afterwards, it gets pretty boring.

Really upset with this game, when it first hit early access I was very excited for the future of this game, but, I guess some developers just don't know how to stick with a game.

reviewText: In early access this game was actually quite good. The 3 dinosaurs, and duplicating glitches, allowed people to enjoy the game and have fun playing it. First, the machette was added instead of the usual bow. The bow was good because, with experence, you could kill any dinosaur you wish. But now its almost impossible to hit or kill the flying Quetzalcoatlus or the rex due to the rex having its ability to stomp on you (even if you are ahead of it sometimes you can be stomped"). What I also dislike was when the rex was in early alpha
recommended: and could kill it with any type of weapon (even a bow if you had enough arrows). If would charge and you would dodge it. Simple as that. Then came the "improvements" with it. The first and fixed part was an increased spawn rate (which was bad
hoursPlayed: I will come back to this point in a minute)
voteText: and secondly they "fixed" the rex running in one direction and can now (on a dime) spin and one shot you. Pair that with horrible hit markers and you got a n almost unkillable beast. The last and final straw was when they added the Quetzalcoatlus. They made the birds so common and so deadly (it would pick you up and drop you to your death) that most players stopped playing until the devs created a patch for them. reviewText:
For those dinosaur fanactics out there, those who enjoyed  carnivores 1 & 2. And any other hunting sim, your welcome to come try theHunter Primal. I have over 400 hours in this game, by far one of my personal favorites among my group of games. Also best played with friends. Going to lay the line out flat now so you guys know the cons before anything else in this game.
1. It's a survival/hunting game, so you have to scanvenge for gear and level for better gear. This depends on your forte in gaming, but there is no crafting in this game. So minecrafters......stay out.
2. Still a few bugs to do with in game, but no need to fear. The devs have cleaned this game quite a bit since early access and its smooth and clean. so far anyway :D
3. if you faint of heart and you don't have a good set of headphones, i suggest you get them otherwise you'll be ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ your pants every 5 mins at the start of your first day alone :P good luck!
Now the pros of this game
1. 5 dinosaur species, Trex, 2 sets of raptors, Velociraptor and Utahraptor <(I'm from jurassic park). and the famous triceratops and lastly the quatzocoatlutus. Each animal is extremely unique and can be very dangerous to you if you dont know whats up, read up your guides and even then, you won't be prepared.
2. Buddies, amazing that you have em. With the games Co-op/pvp servers which you can create on your own simply opening a port in your router. Now you have friends to play with and dont forget steam voice chat! communcation is key when hunting a rex. Or maybe you get caught in a ravine and mashed by 30 raptors :P
3. Very expansive world, there isnt anywhere on this map you can't travel and mutliple biomes to explore. From the plains to the volcano it doesnt get any better then this. I have personally walked the map a few times now, and it roughly takes up to 8 hours if not more to cover it all. Have fun!
4. Graphics are gorgeous even on a lower power PC. The animals look amazing, between the butterflys to the leaves falling the game doesnt get any better than that.
Now you now the pros and cons and a whole 30 bucks and look what it got me :P 400 hours of good ole fashioned fun so please join the game and our community. The more support this game gets the more dinos it may or may not have to weapons etc. And think of you and your buddies getting together to go hunt a rex for that big trophy only to be eaten! Its a blast and it gets my 5 out 5 stars. Good luck out in the field folks!

DON'T LET THE POSITIVE REVIEWS FOOL YOU! MOST OF THOSE WERE WRITTEN BY PEOPLE DURING THE GAME'S EARLY ACCESS STAGE. WHICH THE DEVS ARE CONVENIENTLY INCLUDING WITH THE GAMES FULL RELEASE!

Major network issues with the game. To this day a lot of people still have trouble hosting, even after forwarding the correct ports, which they shouldn't have to do in the first place!

The dino populations and AI are still a mess. There are glitches o' plenty (Birds grabbing you even though you're clearly out of reach, Rexes biting through walls etc.)

Gameplay is missing basic fundamentals. (No jump ability, Crippled Aim Down Site/Slow movement while aiming, inadequate stamina, etc.)

There are no interactions between the Dinos. No Bull Trikes battling each other. No raptors ganging up on Trikes. No rexes eating raptors. Boasting most realistic" and then delivering this as a final product? You gotta be kidding me...

At one point I loved where this game was going.

At this point I cannot recommend it.

reviewText:
Ok, so let me start by saying I do enjoy this game a lot, but I (and im sure many others) would like it a lot better if there were more dino's and possibly even more weapons, but I'm not too fussed about it.

GAMEPLAY
theHunter: Primal is a hunting game. So don't go into it expecting to be able to kill the dino's, cook their meat and eat it, or be able to build a shelter. This game is a survival game, but not in the sense like the forest or stranded deep. I haven't played the normal theHunter game so I'm not sure if this game has the same mechanics, but i do enjoy the tracking system, and the ability to use stealth to your advantage to either hunt or get away from a dino. The game has no plot or storyline which does make it a bit boring for those people who expect to have an overall mission. 8/10 for gameplay.

THE MAP
The world that this game is set on is visually stunning (if you have a decent computer) and is actually really big, so you can spend a lot of hours just navigating your way around the map and discovering the different environments which in itself is enjoyable. The addition of settlements is great because they can provide players with a goal or shelter. 10/10 for the map.

MULTIPLAYER
This game is pretty much just a multiplayer game. There is no point even bothering to play singleplayer because you will die. I am yet to play on a PvP server because personally I find it more enjoyable to hunt with others, not against them. This game is meant for friends to actually play together and take down a rex, which is why you can buy it in a 4-pack. You will find people even in PvE servers that will backstab you and take your stuff, but you will find even more people that will help you survive if you are a new player ( I have helped multiple new player get to a settlement and get some gear). 8/10 for multiplayer.

DINO AI, SPAWNRATE AND HITBOXES
Ok, so this is defeniatly the biggest issue that the game has. The AI for most of the dino's is really annoying and is kinda dumb (they are working on improving this though). The spawnrate of dino's is actually reasonably good at the moment, and pretty much all old players will know of the problems created by some updates (When they increased the rex spawn rate so you couldn't walk through a field without seeing 10 rexes, and the Quetz update where you couldn't walk though a field without being dropped to your death). The hitboxes at the moment are terrible and gotta be fixed. I have been picked up by quetz's when i am standing 10 feet on either side of it, and bitten by Utahraptors even when I sidestep them. 6/10 for the AI, spawnrate and hitboxes

OVERALL VERDICT
Overall, i would defeniatly recommend this game for people looking for a game which provides a good teamwork experience, and are looking to make friends while hunting dino's (it's a win-win if you ask me). I would tell people that want a game where they can just jump in and start spraying dino's to look somewhere else.
8/10 rating for the whole game.

reviewText:
Let's keep it simple.

Graphics: 9/10
Graphics here are nice and solid for the genre.  It won't make you wet yourself with glee but it's nice and clean.  No painful visual issues, at all.  Whoever did the lighting work did an excellent job.

Controls: 8/10
The controls are a bit unwieldy.  I adjusted the keyboard settings and it became quite comfortable though.  (Tip: The grave accent key to the left of the 1 is an excellent key to reassign something to for this one)

Pacing: 5/10
I found the pacing very odd.  I understand that it is an in dev game but there is oddly little to do.  Maybe more will come later but for those considering buying let me simplify it.  Right now, your life will consist of first hiding and crawling around on your belly to avoid scaly monsters.  Then, if you are very very lucky, you will get a weapon and it becomes your job to stop hiding and hunt them.    There are no other activities, strictly speaking, as far as I can tell.  You decide if that's fun for you.

Price: 3/10
While I definitely see the possibility for this game to become good I would say, 'Save your money for a bit.'  This either will drop in price or become worth the current one.  If you have limited gaming funds, try something else.  It is still too uncertain to say where this one will go.

reviewText:
Post Early Access Update!
I've got to say, with all of the constant bug fixing Avalanche has done to this game alone, you'd be crazy not to buy this game. Not to mention all of the great additions they've managed to add on the way. I am also very happy to see the 20% off discount with the game's full release. Grab this great game, folks.

Early Access Review
This game looks like it has GREAT potential in the near future, as long as the developers continue to patch and update the current alpha version. As it stands I would have to recommend this game as long as updates are continuously released and good changes are made.

Of course, it is a 50/50 when purchasing a game this early in alpha stages. THERE ARE BUGS! Keep this in mind.

PROS:
- Great optimization
- Realistic dino sounds. You can hear them a mile away.
- Good sound quality.
- Higher than average graphics. (I have screenshots on my profile w/high settings.)
- Beautiful scenery.

CONS:
- Unstable and strange AI. Sometimes dinos walk over you, sometimes they chase you for miles.
- The dreaded Player Timing Out Message" whenever someone leaves a server.
- Random crashing (Has gotten better with patches)

All of these things are subject to change

reviewText:
Dont really know what i have to say about this game... i bought it during alpha and expected big things from the game, and i got this at full release:
1. 5 Dinosaurs........ 5 DINOSAURS?!?! 4 of them being agressive and only 1 herbivore
2. the ai is so dumb! the dinosaurs only have a couple attacks which are extremely basic and you're never suprised by dinosaur encounters
3. the game is boring, i know its a hunting game and hunting in real life is quite slow paced but the dinosaurs could at least attack each other which would create some excitement when you encounter the occurance.

Overall, my final verdict/word to describe the game is unfinished, and if the developers do nothing with the game after the full release i urge you to not buy this game no matter the discounts it has because it probably isn't selling enough.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is amazing ,atmospheric , light and shade in its ambiance with pretty fluttering insect life,

and there's the Dinosaurs !!

PVE and PVP , yup you can kill other players , hunt em down and kill em!

Yes a glitchy bug ridden experiance , but that said, your paying for early access and all that entails.
it can be a very hard game if you dont follow certain principles , ie stealth ,camoflage, spotting ,staying away from the top of cliff faces =P
however its made easier and more efficiant as you can team up in groups and hunt in a pack , or you may prefer to hunt solo , there's a quick learning curve in staying alive in playing solo.

The guns are great , they look and sound awsome, sometimes echoing around the vast landscape , and it is VAST with teasing out of reach islands begging to be explored , there is no swim mechanic implemented as of yet , so there's a fair bit of speculation knocking around ,so thats healthy i'd guess?.

I have played since its release , and the development team do inform the community and patch reasonably often,
and there is an ingame option for feedback directly to them ,

This game / simulator if reached to the expectancy i personally think is deserved will be a legend amongst any hunting title.

In my humble opinion its very far from complete and i cannot imagine it will be ready by release date.

So if you want to treat yourself , BUY THIS !!

Its scarey and beautiful massive and immersive.

reviewText:
Alright I'm updating my review as the new update came out, and my old review was crap anyways.

This game still has got so much potential, but the devs just need to get their sh!t together and at least make a DLC if nothing else. Also, this game should be an early access game as it has a relatively pathetic amount of content, although even in it's current state the game is very immersive.

You  won't believe how happy I am that they finally updated the game and it seems like there are DLCs coming out. Even though you could call this ''robbery'' since the game is still nowhere near finished I think the devs just need more motivation and this could still be one of the best dinosaur games ever to be released. Since most of you are not going to be reading all this I'll just get straight to the pros and cons of this game.

Pros
-Beautiful and large world
-Plenty of potential
-Extremely immersive

Cons
-Dinosaurs are way underpowered, especially utahraptor and velociraptor
-Huge lack of dinosaur species
-No workshop support

Now, would I recommend this game in it's current state? Well that really depends on what you are looking for when buying this game. If you want to experience the dinosaurs living in their natural environment and experience the prehistoric-like ambience you will most likely love this game, even in it's current state.

But if you aren't interested in this, and you want this game just to hunt the dinosaurs I would not recommend this game at the moment since there are only a few dinosaur species to hunt.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Editted 9 March

So i played this game for a long while now.
I realy like the game and its dinosaurs. Yes they have feathers wich means the developers didnt fall into the jurassic park trap and made all the dino's like the movies.

DINOSAURS

The game now has 4 dino's the Tyranosaurus Rex the Triceratops the Utah Raptor wich is the raptor they SHOULD've used in jurassic park and the Velociraptor. I like the modelling of the dino's and the behaviour off them is great.

I realy Like the new AI Utahraptors are a lot more dangerous and can instakill if you give them the chance.

The Velociraptors are a nice species that is realy hard to see in fiolage and can be a real thread if you are almost out of ammo. It gives a more scary feeling to the game wich is always good.

Rexes are smarter too and use their senses more like smell and hearing. So you should keep your distance without the proper ammo.

Triceratops should still attack more 1 out of 10 attacks at the moment and this isnt enough I think it should be if you shoot badly it should attack you.

GAME OVERALL

I like this game a lot, this is the game i was looking for, for about 10 years now. The survival and hunting combo is great.
Many people are talking about crafting etc but i dont like this. I like it how it is now but i would like some missions. Maybe some sort of campaign in single player and one seperate for multiplayer. Like bring a package there or hunt these animals maybe give some rexes names like in the logs. ( big chop etc...)

Yes i know about the steam achievements but I dont think this will keep me busy.

Leveling is nice and if you choose you can buy some ammo or even weapons and camo in the shop but only when you die. I first thought it to be a bit lame but now I understand that it is to give you a headstart and I like it.
It means that you still have to loot after you bought things when you run out.

PVE or PVP

Well i only played PVE and I realy like the fact of hunting together. Only one thing could be added in PVE and thats locked bags so if you die nobody can steal your stuff. For that they need to do PVP.

WEAPONS

Bow - Its the first weapon you get on primal eden. Its not very powerfull so you have to get close range with dinosaurs and aim very well. I wouldnt advice using it on a rex.

.44 handgun - Nice little handgun for using on the velociraptors and utahraptors although its not strong enough for rex you can kill a trice with it if you aim it right.

Shotgun - My second favorite weapon its a very good weapon against all dino's when you learn how to use it. I have killed many rexes with it close range and against large utah raptor packs its realy the only option to get out off it alive.
It has 2 kinds of bullets Buck wich spreads and Slug wich is a large solid bullet i leave it up to you to find out wich is best for what.

.308 Marksman Rifle - My favorite weapon I use it for all dino's although its very very hard to kill a rex with it because a rex doesnt take much damage from it long range. I think this is unrealistic though and if it becomes more powerfull over long ranges I would use it against rexes aswell.
Oh yeah and it has a scope maybe thats why I like it so much :).

.700 Dual Barrel Rifle - It is the strongest weapon available in the game but weirdly I dont like it very much. It is a heavy rifle and it can kill a rex in 1 - 4 shots if aimed properly.

Because you have limited inventory space you can only take 2 big weapons and 1 little weapon. I choose the shotgun and .308 every single time so I can cary enough ammo for both.

DEVELOPERS

Wel i heard some horror story's about developers before. (ehum stomping lands...)
But i think we can trust this lot, they always answer when they can and they keep fixing bugs and adding stuff.
I realy like what im seeing here keep it up ;).

CONCLUSION

For an early acces game i can only say its great. The developers keep bussy. Its a nice sometimes even enslaving game. If you add ingame missions for me and my mates I would be more than happy.

If I have to give this game a grade I would give it 8 out of 10 maybe it gets to 10 out of 10 when its ready ;).

I would recomment this game to people who like hunting games or shooting games where you have to sneak a lot. And ofcourse people who like dino's. But its not a silly game in wich you cant die by casual playing so keep that in mind.

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nI really like the concept of the game. I've had and played this game since pre-release. It had so much potential. In its current state it is playable, but there are a lot of little bugs that will annoy you over time and you'll reach end game rather quickly with nothing else to motivate you to continue playing. The company behind the game is the main issue I have with the game and not the game concept itself. They are just not putting enough effort into keeping the game fresh and bug free. It's a real shame to see a good idea go to waste, but the company has a real bad track record for neglecting their other titles in similar fashions as they have with this one and being only motivated by money sadly. Now that they have people's money I don't honestly expect anything new (and not just some reskin or rehash) added to the game unless it costs extra and the only bug fixes I'd expect to ever see are ones that are gamebreaking but the little fine tuning ones like the multiplayer bugs will most likely never get fixed. I gave the game and the company a huge amount of time to prove me wrong, but sadly they haven't so now I don't have much hope that this game will ever reach its top potential. I have to vote negative on the game and not recommend it to others unless you're getting it free or as a gift. Just don't waste your money. It's pretty much a game that you'll play through completely once and never touch again as the replayability factor just isn't there. All I can hope for is at some point the company cleans up its act and comes back and actually cares about this game enough to take advantage of its full potential. If that ever does occur I will gladly change my review, but I'm not holding my breath at this point.

reviewText:
I was very, very surprised to see that this game was released to soon after entering early access. A name like Avalanche Studios carries weight with me, and that's mostly the reason I bought this game a few days after it came out on early access. It didn't have much content, but it was in early access, so I has expecting that they'd add more. I was so very much hoping that I'd able to return to this game after a few months of development. I was wrong.

First of all, this is not a bad game. It's a good game, don't get me wrong. The graphics are amazing, the sound design is probably the best of any game I've ever played, the dinosaurs are well designed and the terrain is well crafted. The world is massive and will take you at least an hour to walk from one side to the other on foot.

With that being said, mechanically, this game is sound, more or less. The new flying dinos broke the game with their bugs, (thankfully, the worst one was fixed) they fly through terrain, are sometimes impossible to see or hear, and make you unable to reclaim your gear after you become dino-chow. There are a few more bugs related to the dinosaurs, but thankfully I've never encountered a crash.

The game (to my knowledge) advertised this to be a survival game, but, don't be fooled: there is anything that remotely has to do with the survival" genre that we've come to know and love within games like The Forest and Stranded Deep. The only type of "survival" to be found here is the kind where you avoid not being killed. This IS "survival"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

tldr; I'm recommending this game, but only if you're a fan of Avalanche Studio's other hunting sim, theHunter, and games with roguelike death mechanics, like DayZ or Dark Souls, and only if you'd like to support the development of the game. It's at a point that I would consider very early development.

After only playing this game for a little over an hour, I can say it's extremely challenging in it's current form. If you're adverse to dying a lot early on in a game, then this isn't for you. Unlike in theHunter, everything in these hunting grounds is in reality hunting you, and it's your job to avoid them as best you can, at least until you can get a better weapon than the crappy bow you start with.

When you first spawn, you're presented with the all too familiar tracking/GPS tool you use in theHunter. In this it's called the Settlersmate, the premise of the game being you're a convict, banished to an island on a planet called Primal Eden, and tasked with cleaning up" the island of it's wild life. In front of you is what appears to be the pod you are dropped onto the planet in. It contains an improvised bow
date: 10 arrows and a map fragment. That's your starting kit
recommended: but don't expect to be taking down a lot with it. It does very little to most of the inhabitants of this paradise

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To be honest, I can't compare it to DayZ and/or Rust because it falls into a different category of survival. There is no crafting, hunger etc. (thank god). It gets it's map design concepts from previous dinosaur games such as Turok and Jurassic: The hunted and improves upon them greatly. You can get lost in the atmosphere and your imagination can run rampant. Was that a dinosaur I just heard? Or was my imagination playing tricks on me again?

The Pros:
Tense and Foreboding atmosphere
Outstanding map design
Amazing Soundtrack
No in-game purchases
Smart A.I.
Multiplayer

The Cons:
Multiplayer is buggy (It's early access, what did you expect?)
Only 3 dinosaurs to hunt currently
Walking is a little slow
A.I. pathing is weird around certain obstacles
I only played a few hours so far in singleplayer and already I have had my fair share of memorable moments. I defiantly have high hopes for this game so far. I highly recommend this game if you want to play a serious dinosaur survival game.

reviewText: This game had so much potential during early access. SOOO MUCH. This could've been game of the year (being generous). reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you enjoyed TheHunter and wished you could have an opportunity to hunt dinosaurs with more of a suspense/horror feel to it- this may be the game your looking for. Its got five weapons as of this point in development- Bow, pistol, shotgun with slugs or buckshot, 308 rifle, and the .700 double rifle. Your prey are raptors, tricerotops, and Tyranosaurrus Rex. The game starts off very punishing as you discover alot of your movements only work to aid raptors and rexes to find you. But you get used to how everything works and soon your getting the first attacks in and eventually rounding up the troops and getting revenge on the rex that just ate you.
Seeing a rex lower its head and widen its stance to get ready to charge is downright horrifying. The stomping around as it gets closer and eventually shakes the screen with screams puts you into the scenerio of being the prey for once. Raptors have calls that you will learn as well. They have different vocalisations for when they hear you, when they spot you, and even then they plan on lunging at you.
There are some downers about the game though becuase its still early in development. It crashes alot still, often times at clutch moments right before a big takedown, or after you die, when you drop items, or during a trophy shot. Hosting a game requires you to open ports and thats annoying for many.
I still find that this game is highly addicting and worth playing. I have no doubt in my mind that many of the issues will be ironed out before its formal release. I do love this game and I've been playing it non stop. I recommend this game whole-heartedly.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an amazing game!!
I've played this for over Twenty hours so far, and I love it!!!  I am a huge fan of theHunter so when I saw this was going to be released I know I would have to buy it.  This game has tons of potential, and is very great for an alpha game.  This game really will get your blood rushing when you hear the magnificent Tyrannosaurus rex growl!  When you first get in the game you get a bow, five arrows, and a map fragment.  There is now PVP in theHunter series, if your a fan of PVP you would enjoy it. If your not? You will still enjoy this game.  If you want to hunt a T-rex by your self good luck with that you need about 2-4 people at least to get one of those down.  Any ways this game is amazing and you should check it out this is one of the best 20$ I've spent in a really long time.

-Shawn Spencer

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nConsidering the price, this is the best game I've ever bought on Early Access. It's got a great living ecosystem, well-functioning cooperative and competitive play, and a massive world. My only complaint is the constant pauses in gameplay due to players losing connection to a server (like if their internet goes off, for example). These pauses last no longer than 13 seconds but still can be rather frustrating. The problem is easily solved though by making your own server and ensuring everyone has a stable ping.

reviewText: Considering all of the negative reviews I've seen, I didn't go into this expecting much. Yet, maybe that's why I came out of it pleasantly surprised at the quite enjoyable game play. It's similar to theHunter, which is also made by the same people, in the way it plays. You follow tracks or dinosaur sounds to find them, then shoot them, and have to track them down to claim your prize. However, this being dinosaurs, it doesn't tend to go that smoothly.\nI will admit I've encountered the bug or two, having been launched into the air by a raptor who took a bite out of my face before running away, the stand button suddenly not working as I'm having my groin ravaged or watching as raptors furiously run into a wall as they attempt to flee from me after I've shot them.\nHowever, despite all this. It's fun, and can be quite exhilarating when you suddenly find yourself smashed into by a Quetz for the first time or hear the footsteps of a T-Rex that's now dangerously close, having to fall to the floor and hold your breath in the hopes it will pass you by.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played this game for a few days now, and wow! Such an immersive world. It is frigthening as all heck, it is intense as you won't belive, yet so addictive. There are still few issues with the game here and there, but the shear beauty of the game more than makes up for it. Now, lets list some pros and cons:

Pros:
1) Gorgeous scenery and good graphics
2) Cool weapons
3) 10/10 Audio is unbelievable. You will poo your pants the first time the screen shakes and you hear the t-rex stomping!
4) Supports multiplayer and is extremely fun to play with friends
5) The dinos looks so amazing
6) Giant world to explore

Cons:
1) The dinosaurs can act a bit ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ at times, they don't really behave as you would expect
2) If you crouch or lie still, the dinos will still find and kill you. There is no way to not die if spotted by one
3) Messy inventory aka. no way to mash" ammo together. It just takes up unnessecary space
4) Camoflage does not really work as you would expect

If I had the chance to make any changes in the game as is
date: I would make the dinosaurs behavoiur a bit more "predictable" and realistic in terms of what you would expect to happen if you were either walking very quiet or lying perfectly still. It can be extremely annoying at times when you spot a dino 200 meters away
hoursPlayed: and somehow the thing still manages to track you down and eat you for lunch.\n\nAll in all I really do recommend this game to pretty much any one."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If your up for a challenge hunt, then load in by yourself. Its not hard finding the animals.....they will find you. It starts you with a bow and from there you can use it to protect yourself as you branch out to find weapon and supply crates. If you enjoy a difficult play style then this will keep you on the edge of your seat.
If you have a few friends who also have this game, a lot of fun can be had. The only issue, is you always have one friend that can talk your group into the worst ideas.....such as all 6 of you trying to take down a t-rex with only bows. Can it be done? I dont know, most of us got ate and the survivors spent quite a bit of time crawling out of the area to regroup. It was a bad idea and we all knew it but it was alot of fun.
The people who are reviewing this, saying its too hard, are not skilled players or they have no friends....or both. Just as you do in any hunting game, where you place your shots matter, go for the vital organs or spine. Just keep in mind that the animals your hunting in this game, are not going to get spooked and run away.

As of the time I am writing this, I have 12.3 hrs logged and 0 t-rex kills. But I will continue to play and quote Jurassic Park one liners. When a t-rex is charging a buddy, its too hard not to be yelling over the mic, Shoot Her
date: Shoot Her" or when a friend dies to one 5 min into the game you just gotta say
recommended: "The t-rex doesnt want to be fed

reviewText:
Join pvp room.
Shot people to death when they were getting chased by a t-rex.
10/10 would shot their legs again.

However, there are just only 5 dinos and dev has very little update.
Not many things you can do, yet. Just hide, run, collect weapons and hunt.
The leveling system here allows you to buy weapon ONLY when you're spawning (after died). which is suck. Dev should  add a random drop shop that can buy stuff in limited time.
The map is pretty huge, but good items only appear in some certain bases. So players wont go so far to the end of the map just to get a bow.
Gameplay will get boring after awhile.

But I will still recommend to play this game (only when they have discount, not worth for $30).
Still hoping that the devs will continue to update this game frequently.

EDIT:
Finally some updates for this awesome game. New guns and new boss dinosaur definitely bring me back to this game.
However, the devs have not fix the bug and hacking.

SHOUT OUT TO PEOPLE WHO GOING TO BUY THIS GAME:
1. This is not survival game as your character doesn't have to eat, build or sleep. Just HUNTING.
2. New players should join multiplayer room as they could offer help. (Many players are maxed lvl and they are quite friendly)
3. Hunting will get bored. Join PvP room for intense fun! (BUT, beware of hackers.)

reviewText:
As shown, this review was made April 2015.

This is a game about hunting dinosaurs. Most of the negative reviews indicate how hard this game can be. Hunting dinosaur  shouldn't be easy.

Just like hunting the real world, you need to make your shots at the game's vitals. If you try to headshot a Triceratops it not going to work. If you patiently sneak up to and make a heart/lung shot with a rifle, you'll likely one shot it.

Some other reviews indicate how Quetzalcoatlus, a flying dinosaur are overpowered. The developer has since then made quite a few nerfs towards them. Also, if your good they are easy to oneshot with a shotgun.

A few bugs are present, but game breaking ones aren't very common.

The developer seems to be continuously updating the game, recently just added quite a few weapons into the game. It looks like the game is going a good direction.

reviewText:
Introduction:theHunter is best hunting simulator on steam. And now you can be a hunter on a prehistoric island. What is better than running around in an island with friends hunting T-Rex's and other dinosaurs? This game is a great addition to theHunter series. Being theHunter but with new prey to hunt is great. This game is very well developed, and has quite an active player base with dedicated servers to join friends or other random players.

Pros:You can hunt DINOSAURS
Beautiful graphics and animations
Good net code for online gameplay
Progress/gear can be server transferred
Good weapon mechanics
Very large map

Cons:Few guns or weapons to choose from
Limited clothes/gear selection
Some dinosaurs seem to take too much damage
No vehicles so get ready to walk/run a lot
Sometimes repetitive kills of the same type
No progression system except leveling which doesn't directly give you anything

Conclusion:If you enjoy theHunter, theHunter: Primal is great addition to your library. This gives the same great realistic hunting experience but with dinosaurs that chase you. Only if the overall item list was larger and more diverse prey this game would be perfect. If you're looking for a realistic hunting game with a touch of fantasy this a good choice.

For more reviews check out  Original Curators Group

reviewText:
I can see how The Hunter: Primal can be a hit or miss. The game has sub par graphics and many technical problems, so why am i recommending it.

1) The graphics are still good and it is accaptable for an indie game, i call it this because it is a small company. The graphics do not bother me in the slightest.

2) The gameplay is difficult but very fun. You must learn where certain dinosaurs roam and avoid the dangerous areas until equiped properly. In many of my encounters i am killed quickly but i learned to avoid dinosaurs until i had looted a gun from a supply box. Tactics and teamwork is essential to playing this game.

3) The developers are active and constanlty fixing issues and adding new content to their game.

4) Supplies are always limited adding a scare factor to encounters. Inorder to survive you MUST pick your fights wisely, a pack utahraptors may be best avoided than going comando.

5) Each type of dinosaur has a different personality and tactic they employ. You need to learn the behavior of the dinosaur that you are hunting or you will become the hunted.

6) Players are typically very helpful and friendly.

Overall i would recommend this game to a player who is looking for a game to play on the side. It has many entertaining aspects and the community is very friendly.

reviewText:
I have been meaning to create a huge, in depth review of this game for quite a while, so I hope it is helpful to some new players that, hearing things said from others, may be a little wary.

History of theHunter PrimalThe developers of theHunter and theHunter Primal, Expansive Worlds are constantly involved with educational visits and there is normally at least 2 interns at any time working in the development team alongside the regular, employed developers. The development team have also had lots of requests in the past to add dinosaurs to theHunter and had been interested in doing so in the past before, but they felt it would ruin the realism that many players of the game (a fair amount of which are real hunters). So, behind the scenes they started work on Primal, which was originally given the name 'Project Flintastek' (which according to google translates to 'Flintstones Fry', the developers are Swedish). Project Flintastek also quickly become a program for the interns to work on and quickly became a place where new ideas, gameplay mechanics and... stuff, would be worked on experimentally, after Project Flintastek was starting to look more and more like a complete game, Expansive Worlds decided to make it as a full game and started more serious development on it and thats where we are today.

The StoryStory clearly isn't the main focus of theHunter Primal, nor should it be really, this game is about hunting primarily, however it still manages to tell an interesting story, that is, if you are eagle-eyed enough to find the hidden logs and traces left by previous Pioneers and some kind of native inhabitants, or just, really loopy people. The story that we know first off is that you are sent down onto this alien world to kill (hunt) the native inhabitants, which just happen to be very similar to the dinosaurs that we know from our past. If you fail? Your close family will be offered up as pioneers themselves. So, dont fail. Whilst I say that story shouldn't be the main focus of this game, it would be awesome if it were included/integrated more, such as finding an old camera that would then play a cutscene of a settlement being attacked, or something similar. But, yeah, interesting story but sadly most of it is hidden away in log entries of abandoned old settler mates.

Upon stepping into the game world for the first time...You will be equipped with nothing but a Machete, some basic clothing and boots as well as a map fragment, which will highlight a random settlement on your map (these are the only places to find weapons). It immediatley hits home the feeling of helplessness as you are stuck on an alien planet, with just a machete to defend yourself. However, if you are just starting out, find a map on the internet and go to a settlement. You are going to need a better gun, I would also reccommend playing only on your own for a while as this will help you get better at the game more than if playing with friends.

In the first hour of playing...Within the first hour you will have certainly met your first dinosaurs and hopefully have found your first proper weapon, preferably in reverse order. This is when you will, probably start to get frustrated. This game, you realise, is hard as nails and I will admit, it is very unforgiving for new players to theHunter series or just new players in general. However, if you stick at it like I did and keep trying, you will get the hang of it and start hunting dinosaurs, instead of them hunting you.

General Review of the GametheHunter Primal is, and dont get me wrong here, incredibly frustrating, at times very difficult and can, at its very worst feel like a chore, having to go and get your stuff of your dead body whilst avoiding what killed you. But other than that, the game is so, so enjoyable and when you finally start to get the hang of the game and get used to all of the mechanics etc... it is the most rewarding experience I have ever seen in video games, the sheer feeling of joy when you finally kill your first T.Rex or when you track down a wounded Triceratops to find it later, dead from bleeding damage and to claim it as a kill, or when you find ammo for your favourite weapon or just discover new things, these special moments are what makes the game so, so worthwile. It can also be a very eerie and creepy experience, so people who don't want to get their heart racing should probably stay away from this title... it can get so intense when a T.Rex is just metres away from you and you are just lying in the ferns and vegetation, hoping that it wont spot you and that it will just leave already, the way the ground shakes with its footsteps can be downright horrifying.

So, to put it rather simply, theHunter Primal can be frustrating, but is an intensley rewarding experience that can both make your heart race with joy, or fear. If you are looking for a survival and building game, you wont quite find that here, despite being classed as a survival game this is a hunting game truly, you won't find crafting here.

Quick Reviews of Individual AspectsGraphics - The Graphics in this game are very good and suit the tone of the game well, certain things could be done better, such as the character models and various textures being stretched on some areas of the environment, but this is a good looking game.
Gameplay - This game doesn't play like your typical survival shooter and actually takes a while to get used to how to use all of the functions and elements to aid your gameplay. The controls will feel slightly strange at first but you will definitley get used to it. It plays like a more fast-paced version of theHunter, the movement is faster as well as equipping weapons and items, everything is just smoother and more slick looking, so I would certainly reccommend that you go play theHunter if you are not sure about whether you will like this game, the movement etc is the same however the world and animal species are of couse, very different.
Updates - The developers have never yet missed a weekly update, except when they went on christmas holiday, which, to be fair, is totally acceptable.
Stability -  The game is, admittedly, somewhat plagued by glitches that can hamper (or at times, even enhance your experience) but none of them are of the game breaking variety.

The Future of theHunter PrimalEven though the game is 'finished' at the time of writing (11/05/2015 GMT) the developers have not missed a single weekly update (most commonly published on Thursdays) that will always either contain bug fixes, new content or changes and tweaks to the existing game. The developers say that there is no guarantee of new content to be added to the game however the future looks bright. As theHunter Primal has and will continue to be not just a standalone game, but also a place for interns and the developers to test new ideas and mechanics so it is very likely that, maybe not as frequently as we have had new content recently but it is not unreasonable to assume that as things are experimented with that we will see new content in Primal.

reviewText:
I played this game for about 20 hours now and it seems ok. Every now and then I would encounter a bug such as a flying Utahraptor(or whatever their called) or a wall-clipping T-Rex. This didn't happen often but when it did I lost alot of good stuff and I got quite upset. My final complaint is that the AI in this game are really dumb or really smart and by that I mean sometimes they would spot me from a mile away when im crouching or prone, other times I could walk right in front of them without being spotted. In conclusion when the game is being fair I have alot of fun hunting and tracking dinos. I understand that this game is still in development but some of the problems are killing my gaming experience.

[EDIT 1, 4/7/16] I came back to this game after not playing it for awhile and I am glad to see that some issues have been fixed but unfortunately some new issue seemed to have popped up as well. Crate spawns appear to be unbalenced. There are times where I would be walking for a hour without finding a single crate and there are other times where I would find 5 crates in under 7 minutes. I also tried playing multiplayer PVP. I joinded an almost full server and walked around the map for two hours without finding a single person. Until the developers add a way to find and track players quicker I would not reccomend playing PVP. On the other hand PVE seems to be just fine. In PVE you can see other players on the map so it is easier to find people. In conclusion this game has gotton a lot better since my last review but I believe It still needs more work.

Pros:
-Realistic Dino Tracking
-Nice Looking Enviornment(Not The Best Looking But Still Good)
-Money/Shop System Works Fine
-GPS Feature

Cons:
-Dinos Sometimes Wall-Clip(Walk/Kill Through Walls)
-AI Are Really Dumb or Really Smart
-Spawns Are Horrible
-Crate Spawns Are Unbalenced

Graphics-7.5/10
AI-6/10
Preformance-9/10
Gameplay-7/10

Overall I would rate this game a 7.5/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I felt the same sense of immersion and enjoyment as a kid playing Carnivores 2 on the family win98!

Getting hunted down by a pack of raptors, hearing them chirp back and forth to one another,
knowing they are hunting you. The feeling of accomplishment when you take 5 minutes to crawl
and inch closer to a raptor, just to get a perfect shot with your new .308 rifle. Playing with friends,
coordinating a crossfire on a triceritops, unleashing a hail of bullets. Taking a group pic and laughing
about how awesome it was. Then running when you realize we used up most of our ammo and that a
T-rex can heard our little cannonade.

Seriously though, this game is amazing.
The game has its core features down, and it's alot of fun. Me and a few friends own the game now,
and its always a blast to play together. I'll admit, it has issues like crashing and missing features,
but the devs are releasing a patch at a pace of about once per week, and are listening to community feedback.
Since I started playing the game the devs have already fixed my biggest gripes about the game,
which is new to me on a game thats still in early access.

Thank you Expansive Worlds! Thanks for all the enjoyment The Hunter and Primal have brought,
and for your listening to the community, as well as continued updates!

reviewText:
After being eaten through trees, stood on top of by triceratops', and spawning directly next to tyrannosaurs I am done with this game.

Calling this a survival game is laughable at best. There is no crafting, there is no real permanent shelter or objective. You walk, crawl, and run around hoping that the buggy glitchy dinosaurs dont ignore the multiple shotgun slugs to their heads and kill you.

The newest addition, quetzocoatalus, is the biggest annoyance of all. Spent HOURS collecting items, guns, and ammunition? Too bad. death from above one hit killer.

Utahraptor, velociraptor, tyrannosaurus, quetzocoatalus, and triceratops are the only other living things in this game. Its a little pathetic that in 2015 a game developer has only 5 dinosaurs in their DINOSAUR HUNTING GAME.

Saying this is release worthy is embarassing to the devs, and insulting to everyone who paid for early access. If I could return this piece, I would. Don't waste your money on it.

reviewText:
This is the best game featuring dinosaurs I've ever played.  The Cretaceaous style world looks and sounds great.  The dinosaurs sound realistic to me, meaning they sound like actual animals instead of movie monsters.  Their behavior seems believable as well.  This is a hunting game and not an all out action game, so patience and thought are required.  There is a minimal storyline that serves it's purpose, but this game is all about your experiences hunting, being hunted, and trying to survive.  This game creates some truly frightening situations.  You really feel like you're being stalked.

I think there should have been a couple more herbavore species in the game, because as far as i know, the triceratops is the only plant eater in the game.  The rest are carnivores, which makes it seem less realistc.  The weapons are very scarce.  I'm glad it takes time and effort to get them, but sometimes they seem too hard to come by.  I always play alone, so this problem is probably not so bad in multiplayer, since you can scavenge weapons from dead players.

I would certainly recomend this game to anyone that likes dinosaurs and/or hunting games.  I'm already hoping for a Jurassic themed sequel or add on.

reviewText:
I thoroughly liked playing this game. I've played almost right when the game came out. I heard of it through TheHunter. Since at the time, I played just Thehunter. But, In the end, I ended up playing this one over the normal TheHunter. There was more to do with friends and it was a faster pace. Who doesn't like Dinos? It's a very pretty game, and realistic looking. But anyways, this game has been through many changes. There was a time where Triceratops were nice and ran away. And also a time where there were groups of T-Rex would never let you retrieve your items, Lol. I can remember how mad I was back then. Back in that time too, there was no in-game store, when you died. So there was no point to die. This game was just so much fun to play with my friends. I miss the times we had, haha.

To keep the game alive, They could and should add more to the game, even if it's DLC. A new map with 5 more dinos would be nice. More places to visit, new guns in the new map. They could also add more achievements along with that. One more thing that would be nice, is more characters. You do kinda get tried seeing the same people everywhere, since there's only 4 to choose from.
>>>But going along with this, there are some bugs that are really annoying. They need fixed bad. One is where the drop-pod disappears and you don't get anything in there that you bought, obviously. And there's another where when a dino is shot and it glitches the animal in an idle state, and you can't claim it. (Though sometimes you can, if you figure out where it actually died.) But the one that is the most annoying- There is one where if you set extra ammo you bought down, it disappears. That is really in need of fixing.<<<

Anyways, overall I feel this game is worth buying. But keep in mind, this game isn't just like COD or any crazy shooting game. You can't just expect T-rex to die in one shot. And you the player are slow, you do not have infinite stamina or ammo. So running around shooting, you are going to waste your ammo. If you like games where you can just shoot with unlimited ammo, go play something else.

My Rating: ★★★★☆.

reviewText: I got this game in a Bundle thinking it would be a really good game to play with my friends, However the gameplay wasn't enough to keep my full attention. it wasn't very exciting to travel less than 20 feet only to be killed by 3 Utahraptors that was the first time i actually played it. right then and there I knew something was wrong with the mechanics of this game. a few things I really didn't like about this game. #1 there is no hip fire when trying to get away from anything you can only aim and fire you cannot move away or even try to escape anything attacking you while trying to fire at it. #2 when you have traveled across the map and you die the map goes blank again like you were never there, unless you can get back to where you died before dying again and again. #3 this is not a single player game it is but it's meant to be played in groups of people the only problem with this is when you play a single player game you travel and so do others and when you join a Multiplayer map people are all over the place you can't ever find them not even your friends. it's a mission just to find anyone on a server. #4 the graphics on this game don't impress me not many settings not many options. #5 and A.I themselves get stuck if one is chasing you and you go up a hill it will get stuck on a rock and stay there allowing you to kill it. it won't go around it wont try to get unstuck it will just stay in that place and keep running. #6 Carry weight you can only carry so much weight and when you have the .700 Double Barrel Rifle it takes up a lot of weight 25% i believe, even though they claim it's the most effective rifle to take down the T-rex finding ammo for this rifle is almost impossible trying to stay alive while finding it is also impossible. Ammo in general is easy to find keeping it is another thing how many shots does it take to kill a T-Rex? everything you shoot at you run out of ammo they charge you kill you with one hit and you start the game over again and again and this gets a little repeitive. I didn't read any of the reviews on this game because I wanted to play it for myself and do my own review.  this game has a lot of potential but it lacks a lot of things that will make it a great Multiplayer game. #7 the glitches are very annoying the crashes are as well, you can't save your progress to keep your map open or to find your way back to the pile of poop to get your Map fragments that the T-Rex pooped out When it ate you. I was hoping for a lot of great things in this game but I only found that the more I played it the more I hated it. #8 the weapons or lack of them. 11 different kinds of weapons but no Machine guns no throwing weapons no explosives no shoulder fired weapons So the very basic weapons to survive the Dinosaur world, if your alone and you fire at one most likely it will kill you. maybe the devs who made this game had godmode and unlimited ammo because I highly doubt they can survive 1 day without it. #9 when you split ammo you lose some of it somehow could be a glitch but it has happened since day 1 and it's annoying. this is one of those games that you should look at watch some video's of it but keep walking. i would have hated to play this game right out of early access and now it's been a while I can see the problems with the game when it was released are still going strong. #10 in a group of 8 people we decided to go through a dense forrest to get to 4 other players who were on the other side Well between us all we had a small Army of weapons none of us made it out because the Velociraptors killed everyone they move faster than you can aim at them they kill you even faster they jump on your face start sucking out your eyeballs and move onto the next hunter when your dead. they are easy to kill but you have to be able to hit them. the game settings keep changing during gameplay if you set your aim at a higher rate and your look at a higher look the first time you encounter anything the game changes your settings so you can't keep up with the movement of the Dinosaurs and that is another reason I hate this game. needing to go back into settings but wait you can't you can only do that before you start the game what a joke. no game settings while in game? 2 Thumbs down on this game. I think ill wait for about a year before playing this title again.

reviewText:
This game is actually really fun.

Regardless of what may or may not be going on with the developers, the game seems to work fine and it has had updates since the devs have supposedly left, so I guess the game is being maintained by ghosts or something.

Now then, gameplay.
Gameplay is alright, you waddle about as you do in the regular theHunter, it is a shame that you waddle at a painfully slow speed unless you run which you can do for all of 5 seconds every minute or so.
You find little boxes filled with gear and there are lots of nasty things out to get you.
Sound simple? It is!
Staying alive is very difficult because everything kills you.
That's a nice pink plant, oh wait no, it's killing me, oh look a herbivore, hello herbivore, oh it killed me that's great.

That's pretty much the whole game, there is a level system but I don't ever see myself maxing it out.
This means the game can get painfully dull if you don't set yourself objectives, you know the sort of thing, find a certain gun, kill so many of a certain dino, attempt to go up the mountain.

But wait there's more!
There's multiplayer, now I've only played on non-pvp public servers and it's pretty cool, you'll see a group of people just destroying t-rexes like they're nothing, then you'll see them all get taken down by a triceratops.

Graphics
They're nice


Things that I don't like
You can't swim, you're on an island with rivers and stuff and you can't bloody swim.
YOU CAN'T SWIM ON AN ISLAND.
IT'S AN ISLAND MATE COME ON THE FASTEST WAY TO GET FROM ONE PENINSULA TO THE OTHER IS BY WATER
IT'S NOT EVEN LIKE YOU DROWN YOU JUST STAND NEAR THE WATER ALL CONFUSED
The freaking not pterodactyl, stupid bird thing that just swoops at you, glitched out looking like it's stood up, absolutely awful to look at.
The spawn system, you spawn rougly 60 seconds from where you die, which is good and bad, you die to a raptor that's fine you'll get him, you die to a rex and say goodbye to that server.

All in all a decent bit of fun 7/10 actually good.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Overall, and accounting this is in early release/access, it’s a pretty decent game and I really like to play it.
Like theHunter, it has great graphics (I love those sunshine/sunsets!) – it’s the same engine :) and really sweet sounds. The t-rex walking sound… is simply superb! And you can imagine that this game will get better and better over time, as EW by this many years doing the theHunter are experts in hunting games.
Unlike theHunter, it’s a fast paced game where you will enjoy every minute. Sometimes I got bored in theHunter because I would rush and eventually scared off the animals ending up not seeing one or taking a lot of time to find one. In theHunter: Primal, you don’t have that problem. If you can’t find an animal, they will find you! (and you might regret it… lol). Also, there’s nothing else to pay in the game. In Primal, you just buy the game and that’s it. Everything that’s in game it’s yours and you don’t have to pay for anything else.

Complete opinion at http://www.hucorner.com/blog/thehunter-primal-early-access/

reviewText: The best game with dinosaurs!
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is pure awsome. Hunting them dinosaurs is fun, its an enjoyable game. 8/10
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
DETAILED PROS AND CONS - TL;DR PARTS HAVE THESE THINGS [ ]

Pros:


- Looks pretty. Really pretty.

- Runs on a toaster at 60 frames, even if it says 3 ghz processor my buddy can run it fine on low with a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ laptop.

- DINOSAURS.

- Rewarding when things go to plan.

- [Dinosaurs have all of their internal organs mapped out and different weapons will have different effects in the sense that you probably wont penetrate the skull of a T-REX with a bow.]Enemies have lungs,heart,spine,neck, all that good ♥♥♥♥ just like all the animals in theHunter and they respond accordingly. If you put holes in a T-REX's intestines, he is going to bleed out very slowly. If you damage it's legs it's going to move slower. The more blood it loses the more it is stunned and once it is really not feeling well it'll likely try to run away to the safety of others T-REX-es.

- [Tracking system of theHunter, including the ability to find DINOSAUR ♥♥♥♥. ]Scan tracks with the PDA to get detailed information rather than just looking at them, but if you're a badass following them as they run away in fear (like me) you can just look at it and the finer details of the track are physically able to be seen on the ground (bright red blood for lungs/heart and darker for body). This also includes if the animal is fleeing or just roaming an area, or whatever, just like theHunter.

- Dynamic experiences in the game can make for some very memorable moments. A friend and I were in a large open area on a huge volcanic rock formation when we heard raptor sounds on the other side. Suddenly spanned 10 meters apart infront of us, 4 raptors slowly started to walk towards us. We fired, they charged, had an epic showdown where my buddy almost got killed as 2 we did not see earlier decided to flank us hard along our right, which was covered by rocks.  Another time we both managed to stealth our way past a pack of T-REX(es?).


- It seems [certain types of dinosaurs inhabit certain types of terrain], a pack of T-REX can be found in a valley and around it for a while, while we encountered many raptors in dense forest (p.s: spooky as ♥♥♥♥)

- Variety of terrain, has swamps, valleys, large dark forests, large bright forests, forest clearings, large mountains, volcanic rock stuff, deserted settlements etc.

- Map is pretty ♥♥♥♥ing big. And I mean, pretty ♥♥♥♥ing big.

- Really nice atmosphere, rebuilt sound system from theHunter to give you a really nice experience with a world that feels alive (can see butterflies and dragonflies and all that ♥♥♥♥, mice on the jungle floor at times).

- [Can find datapads with lore and further story of the game found on them, mostly diary entries of characters that had spent their time there before.] Can usually find decent loot here and they're near settlements or camps and ♥♥♥♥.

- (Opinion) Game isn't meant to be easy and you do have to learn as you play to know how to survive. I managed to get it down quite quickly since you can take from the mechanics of theHunter. It's similar to theHunter except much more rewarding to successfully evade your enemies, since they are essentially hunting you at times when you need to hide.

- (Opinion) T-rex likes to nominate you for their space program



CONS:

- [Dinosaurs DO NOT ATTACK EACHOTHER.] Seriously this one was the worst to find out, big ole triceratops was rushing a T-REX I was hiding near and he just runs right past to have a sip out of the water. Worst ♥♥♥♥ing thing, I was expecting him to go FULL ♥♥♥♥ING BRAWL/BRO MODE. But nah, never happened. Hopefully this gets added in.

- [Only FIVE types of dinosaur are in the game right now.] Hopefully they add more but right now they have Utahraptors, T-rex and Triceratops, Velociraptos and the Quetzalcoatlus.

- [Not too many weapons in the game, as I've found all of them] (.44 revolver, .700 double rifle, .308 marksman rifle, the 12G pump action, the bow, the machete and the extremely rare .50). Hopefully more come in future.

- AI pathfinding can SOMETIMES be a ♥♥♥♥. And by that, I mean the T-rex sees you, you go prone, and it just runs up to you and stands on your body where you can go crouch and fill the ♥♥♥♥er with arrows without it doing ♥♥♥♥. Also utahraptors and velociraptors like to stop and have a smoke sometimes rather than attacking you (this is somewhat fixed but it is still there).

- [NO ♥♥♥♥ING VEHICLES]. While I don't really mind that much since I played many hours of numerous walking simulators and sleeping games (modded arma 2, dayz, breaking point, EVE online) I'm probably going to get ♥♥♥♥♥♥ at some point that I don't have some sort of lame vehicle or something. Let me ride a Triceratops, devs. Let me be a dino-rider and relive childhood. That'd be so ♥♥♥♥in' baller.

- (Opinion) Not really a big one, I like hunting and all, but after the first encounter where you find out that most times raptors have the common courtesy of letting you know they're there before attacking, alot of the horror element subsides. This might be just me not being afraid of things because I'm a STONK HAIRY MAN and if you're a little ♥♥♥♥♥ (that's okay, some of us are) you might always see horror in this game aside from the first encounter.

Now, I know tips are more of a guide thing but I honestly can't be ♥♥♥♥ed making a guide, I'm the god of hunting dinosaurs (not really) and I have better ♥♥♥♥ to do than write a guide. Still, I want to help so take these tips and don't quit early.


TIPS:

- DINOSAURS ARE TOUGH ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥S. DO NOT FIGHT T-REXs ALONE WITHOUT LOTS OF AMMO AND A GOOD VANTAGE POINT. DO NOT FIGHT TREXs WITH FRIENDS WITHOUT LOTS OF AMMO AND A GOOD VANTAGE POINT. 6000 KG OF SCALE ARMOUR AND REPTILE ♥♥♥♥, DON'T DO IT.  Fight raptors all you like though. If you manage to spot them first and you want to fight, see how many there are. With starting gear and not much experience you could probably take down one, then once you know where their weak spot is at the front take on more and more, depending on how capable you are with aiming.

- In regards to the last tip, fighting them is the best way to learn how to kill them. If you manage to bring any dinosaur down and he's alone, take a screenshot of the kill page and look for vital spots to try shoot at next time. Be careful, raptors are rarely alone.

- Use stealth. It's the only way you'll survive to find a shiny rifle and ammo, aswell as some camo clothes and all that dandy ♥♥♥♥. You'll learn more about dinosaur behavior that way.

- Always assume that the highest % guess of health from blood sprays is what the dinosaur has. A friend of mine was tracking a T-REX for quite some time, thinking it had basically none left but it had a high end scale % he didn't quite take into account.


- This game is not supposed to be easy. I mean it is for me, because I'm so cool, but if  you're a quitter, you shouldn't buy into this game. It will take time to know what you're doing unless you have a friend guiding you that knows whats up. The challenge is what makes the game rewarding, and thats what I really really love about this game.


Anything you want me to address let me know, will update review as the game is updated.

reviewText:
This game I see has got alot of negativity, mostly from those who havent played the game more than a few hours and rage quit after getting killed a few times. There is no doubt that this game takes a while to get used to, even I used to get extremely frustrated at not being able to locate settlements with weapons. But once you start to learn thestructure of the map and the mechanics of the game, and you start to learn new skills and stratagies, this is an extremely fun and exiting game to play solo and with friends. The concept of theHunter: Primal is great, the graphics and enviroment is breathtaking and overall this game truly does deserve more attention. I highly reccomend this game to anyone who loves survival, dinosaurs, action and of course having a great time.

For those who are just starting out, here are some useful tips:

Survival:

The Hunter Primal is all about killing dinosaurs, finding gear and most importantly, survival. You may find the best gear but if you don’t know how to survive and keep it, it’s pointless. If you come across a dinosaur that you are not equipped to fight, you must hide. The best way to stay undetected is by crouching instead of walking if you hear something, and lying in thick bushes if something gets too close… Around the map, you can find health canisters which you can use if you are struggling for health. So if you have one and you need it, don’t save it, use it! When you come across a cliff or steep drop, you should never take the chance of just walking off to get where you want to go, you will most likely just fall to your death…


Killing Dinosaurs:

Utahraptors:

To kill these vicious beasts, it’s all about hitting them in the heart. You can hit them as many times as you like anywhere else and pretty much nothing will happen. To hit their heart, you must hit them directly in the front center of the body. Hits such as in the back of the spine or in the lungs (which are in the center of the side body) are effective too. It is recommended to use a weapon such as a pistol or shotgun against these.

Velociraptors:

These turkey sized predators can really mow you down if you are not careful, there is no set way to kill these, all you have to do it hit them and they will die… Using a machete or axe is by far the best option when fighting these things, although be prepared as they can come in packs of up to 12…

Tyrannosaurus Rex:

I reccomend NOT attacking this alone! You should always bring a friend along. (by playing online) If you choose to take on one, be sure to bring powerful guns and plenty of ammo. You need guns with at least the power of a 308 Rifle but a 700 Rifle or .50 Cal is recommended. When firing at this beast, you want to be hitting the heart which is located in-between its small arms.

Triceratops:

When taking on a Triceratops, you need to have a decent weapon with plenty of ammo, it is unlikely to attack you but you never know. When trying to hit it, go for the lungs, spine and heart. It is recommended to use a 700 Rifle or a 308 Rifle with plenty of ammo.

Quetzalcoatlus:

This flying dino can be annoying considering it can be hard to hit, the best way to take one down, is to shoot at its body as it attacks by swooping down on you. They are quite fragile creatures and can be taken down with as little as two hits from almost any gun.


Settlements & Gear:

Finding Settlements:

It may seem hart at first, but finding settlements is very easy. When you start the game, you will get a “Map fragment” when you use that, you will be revealed a settlement on the map, all you have to fo is set a waypoint there by going on the map and clicking a point and go for it!

Finding Weapons/Ammo:

Weapons and ammo spawn at places called settlements" these are marked by little symbols on your map. The best place to go is the settlement at the top of the volcano in the center of the map. This is the ony place you can find the .50 cal rifle
date: however it is still extremely rare. At this settlement you are likley to find shotguns and good camoflauge equipment."

reviewText:
Pros:
A pretty big map, nice scenery and settlements, plenty to explore.
11 weapons in the game, plenty of weapons to play around with, some powerful, some not.
Fun to play with friends.
You have to shoot at vital organs on the dinosaurs or end up wasting a lot of ammo, this is a nice accurate addition besides just shooting and the dinosaur dropping no matter where you hit.
Raptors hunt in packs, coming from several directions.
Dinosaurs make recognizable sounds, alerting you to where they are and depending on how loud the sound is, how far away they are and what they are.
Pretty decent A.I, can be buggy at times but still pretty okay on that part.
Accurate shooting, holding your breath makes your gun more steady, laying down and crouching do as well.
Textures on dinosaurs are pretty nice looking and also vary.
Several variants of dinosaurs like rare, uncommon, and common.
Dinosaurs have different weights, each dinosaur has a mininum and maxiumum weight, some can be quite a bit smaller than others in that species.
The heavier the dinosaur is, the more points you get from it and the more EG(in-game currency) and also the more xp you get from it.
In-Game store when you die is a nice feature for getting ammo and new guns, although you need certain levels to get those.
Leveling system makes it where you have things to work towards.
About 67 achievements, very fun to try and get them all!
You can grab rocks off the ground to throw and distract dinosaurs with temporarily allowing more shooting.

Cons:
Game seems to be abandoned by devs so far, no more updates.
A.I is buggy at times for the dinosaurs.
Quetzalcoatlus sometimes freezes after you kill it in mid air and finally drops out of the sky in a random location around you.
Rexes come straight to you after you shoot them, there is no finding you involved, its just KNOWS where you shot it from and comes to get you, so you have to get several shots in, sometimes not allowing for good shots and leading to ammo waste.
Game came out of Early Access before it was ready, making a lot of people annoyed and bringing up the negative review count.
Getting your bag back after you die can get annoying if you don't have the money or levels to get guns when you die to escort yourself.
Can be a hassle to find more ammo unless you just sit around waiting for camp boxes to respawn, doing this can take a while.
Unstrustworthy people can steal your loot after you die if you're not careful when playing on public servers with people you don't know on the game.
Items can dissapear from boxes if you split, say, ammo in it, put some in your inventory, close the box and open it again.
Can be frustrating for new people and make them quit quicker than they would with a little guidance and help from a trustworthy player who has played for a while.


Well that's all I can think of for now.

TL:DR
All in all a fun game for a little bit at least, very fun with several friends to play with, fun to take down rexes like this.
Decent A.I, some of it still needs work though.
Devs pretty much abandoned game so far, so no more updates coming.
Plenty of achievements to get.
Dino's have different skins.
Plenty of weapons to play with, both weak and powerful.
In-Game store allows for re-stock when you die.
When you play with people you can trust, you die less and have more fun.
