reviewText: ♥♥♥♥ing terrible. Seriously, ♥♥♥♥ing terrible. Your character starts with an improvised machete and the stamina of a newborn kitten. You then walk around very slowly (or run for about 5 seconds before your stamina is exhausted and takes forever to recharge) in a dull, lifeless environment to find dinosaurs. When you find them, you need to use your improvised machete (possibly made from discarded plastic scissors) to swing 4 or 5 times at them as they dance around you, before losing all your stamina. At this point you're forced to join them in their dance, as neither of you can really do anything to change the situation, you bring limited by the poor tools at your disposal and them being limited by the cripplingly stupid AI.\n\nI award you no points

reviewText:
With the progress this game has, its done pretty well, as I'm playing the game, I don't know if I'm the hunter or the hunted, as there are predators likely to kill you like the Mighty Tyrannosaurus or intelligent raptors, Triceratops is one herbivore you either want to give a wide berth or if you crazy and have a machutte or a gun capable of killing one, good luck with that. The Quetzalcoatlus seems to be getting a bad rap apparently from most people. I guess they been grabbed, but if they come at you DUCK AND COVER! And if you got a gun like a shotgun that is your weapon against the flying buzzards.

Triceratops you can fool by using a Trike Caller, and wait until it arrives and then strike and aim for the heart.
Velociraptors you can just slash at them as they die real easy.
Utahraptors are a challenge as they'll either be alone or in a pack, so watch out!
And for the ultimate challenge, welcome to Tyrannosaurus Rex, the alpha predator of Primal Eden as of now until there is something new.

For a T-rex, aim for the heart and lungs don't bother hitting the head as the predator is really large (30-43 feet in size).

Anyways, survive and explore, and happy hunting.

reviewText: The game is not really a survival game but more of a hunting game where you are a forced hunter simply to stay alive on a planet you have been dumped on. So a better tag would be hunting simulator". If you try to run and gun you will die most times although in ceratin cases you can do this. The weapons are geared towards hunting not a frantic FPS experience. Strategy and tactics are needed to survive in this game initially but once you get a handle on the controls of the guns
recommended: crouch and prone and then stand again you will be a master hunter. Did I say you are hunting dinosaurs? The devs did not abandoned the game but are adding updates slowly because their main game is "theHunter". In december of 2015 the devs added new weapons and a new Primal dinosaur and also with it came several bugs they need to fix. The game is good at its core and looks beautiful so have patiences with it and enjoy it for what it is until they add more dinos and other stuff whatever that may be and whenever that may be. If it has the support they will continue to make it a great game. FOR THE PRICE or on sale it is worth doing all the achievements and hopefully finding your first gold T-rex so you can summon a Primal T-rex. Remember it is not a run and gun game. It will be hard when you first start off. Explore the map and die if you must looking for settlements. Once you learn the map things will be easier to find. Crates have stuff you can use but only settlements have the weapons and camo. Have fun and happy hunting.\n\nApril 2016 Review: A game still worth playing if you like simulators. Don't compare it to any other game where you can just blow off bullets or 1 headshot kill an enemy or animal. The devs have it the way it is so you have use some skill to prevail. It is not am MMO so there isn't any quirky stuff like mounts and taming. It is for mature people mostly but kids can enjoy it too as long as they see it for what it is: A HUNTING SIMULATOR where you have to work for your stuff and learn to be good at it. I even had a negative comment about the game on my Youtube page about "if you can't headshot a dinosaur in the brain once then the game sucks" or something similar to that. What shallow thinking. What idiocy. The game is good but still has bugs but if you have a good system to play on the bugs don't seem to fly as much. Therefore
hoursPlayed: it is still worth the price and if it is on sale definately get it. It has COOP so playing with friends is fun too.\n\nHAPPY HUNTING (Look for my videos on Google : GameCookerUSRocks)"

reviewText:
With the progress this game has, its done pretty well, as I'm playing the game, I don't know if I'm the hunter or the hunted, as there are predators likely to kill you like the Mighty Tyrannosaurus or intelligent raptors, Triceratops is one herbivore you either want to give a wide berth or if you crazy and have a machutte or a gun capable of killing one, good luck with that. The Quetzalcoatlus seems to be getting a bad rap apparently from most people. I guess they been grabbed, but if they come at you DUCK AND COVER! And if you got a gun like a shotgun that is your weapon against the flying buzzards.

Triceratops you can fool by using a Trike Caller, and wait until it arrives and then strike and aim for the heart.
Velociraptors you can just slash at them as they die real easy.
Utahraptors are a challenge as they'll either be alone or in a pack, so watch out!
And for the ultimate challenge, welcome to Tyrannosaurus Rex, the alpha predator of Primal Eden as of now until there is something new.

For a T-rex, aim for the heart and lungs don't bother hitting the head as the predator is really large (30-43 feet in size).

Anyways, survive and explore, and happy hunting.

reviewText: I felt like I should write a review for this game.  First of all, I had a lot of fun playing it when it was first released.  The devs promised a lot more content, so I stuck around for a while.  I really love hunting games, and this game gave me dinos.  The AI at first was okay I guess, but barely realistic.  When the devs messed with the AI, the game became sort of broken.  Nothing was hard to kill anymore, even the trikes are stupid easy.  After I killed a rex with a bow, I got bored.  Almost 100 hours of mostly fun game time, though.  When this game becomes a three dollar sale, go for it.  Just know that it is very unlikely that this game will go anywhere.  ARK: Survival Evolved is taking over as the Dino Niche game for now.  I have that game, too.  It's much more fun, imo.  However, I can't REALLY say that I dont' reccommend the game...I can just say that it's not worth the current retail.  It's largely unfinished, and there are just too many bugs to make it a solid game.  Hope this helps.  Giving it a thumbs down over all, but wish I didn't have to.

reviewText: I went into this game after watching Jacksepticeye play it and i had high hopes for it: a dangerous planet full of dinosaur life and you must hunt while scavenging for suplies and survivng. While it sounds good on paper and sounds like it would be like the iOS game, Carnivores, this game is sadly a tedious attempt at a great game. Where Carnivores had good hunting strategies, sudden death as always a fear, fast travel, and a way to find your prey, this game lacks most of the listed. It is merely a running simulator, where you can literally press Q to automatically walk. The hunting system in the game is interesting to say the least. If you pick up on your prey's trail, you can actually track them on your device through their footprints and whatnot. The area is pretty well designed to say the least, giving the impression of a vast, open, and terrifying open world, but that is not the case. There are hardly any dinosaurs and the combat is done so ♥♥♥♥ poor its nearly impossible to kill any of the dinos. Not to mention walking around waiting for something to happen can get pretty tedious after a while. All in all, i would not recomend spending your money on this game. If you want to, then by all means go for it. Its not a terible game, but it will become boring.

reviewText: ♥♥♥♥ing terrible. Seriously, ♥♥♥♥ing terrible. Your character starts with an improvised machete and the stamina of a newborn kitten. You then walk around very slowly (or run for about 5 seconds before your stamina is exhausted and takes forever to recharge) in a dull, lifeless environment to find dinosaurs. When you find them, you need to use your improvised machete (possibly made from discarded plastic scissors) to swing 4 or 5 times at them as they dance around you, before losing all your stamina. At this point you're forced to join them in their dance, as neither of you can really do anything to change the situation, you bring limited by the poor tools at your disposal and them being limited by the cripplingly stupid AI.\n\nI award you no points

reviewText: Whats sad is this game has the potential to be a very good game but do the developers try? No. Updates take months, their last update was just to add Hungarian localization. Let me adress that... you speant months just to add Hungarian localization? There are no new dinosaurs, no new guns, new anything is absolutely 0. This game could be amazing, but the developers are just chipping in on the cash everyone spends without giving back to the customer who paid to play their game. The game has become repetitive and a snooze, am I the only one who dreads walking? What can sometimes take up to an hour to get to the other side of a map? Why not throw in a vehicle and the only way to get fuel is to find it at a base. Base locations, heres an idea make a few places actually look like a base, it'd be cool to be able to enter into buildings and search for crates or maybe through lockers for items to use and have some smaller dinos lurking inside. What would I rate this game if i had to say 1-5 I'd give it a 2 the graphics are amazing but that doesnt make up for the fact that this game is brutally lacking. Not enough dinosaurs, hardly any guns. It gets old and you will get bored of this game. Would i recommend this game? Nope like i said before not enough content and asking for 30 dollars for an early access game that i thought would be updated on a regular basis is pretty scummy. 30 dollars people, we paid them 30 dollars for this unfinished game. I would not even deem it early access any more I'd say they're done updating this, they prooved that with the Hungarian localization". Months and months upon waiting for dinosaurs and guns only to get that... Sorry but this game will probably be uninstalled on my list. I'll check back on it in a year or 2 to see if anything has changed which I highly doubt."

reviewText:
Part 3 of my review now into the game 900+ hours.

All I have to say is look at my screenshots and my Youtube videos to get your own opinion.
I still recommend it at $19 or on sale.

Part 1 of my review near the beginning of me playing:
I do not know if the devs will read this but they should keep working on this game and make it the greatest coop hunting game ever. It is not easy imo,at least, at first. If they add more dinos and more hunting weapons and more situations to be involved in this game will be fun and challenging. I have watched gameplay videos which seemed to show challeneg. And I checked out the world myself a bit and got attacked by a little guy who gladly dragged me off for food I presume so I am pleased that it is not in the spirit of an MMO where dying essentially is obsolete. For the low price I think people should get on board with this game to keep the devs making content for it. I only had a machete to start and really did not know how to fight so I imagine the weapons will take some time to get use to which is fine for me for this type of game. Note: I am not a hard core gamer either. People said the world is ugly. I am not sure where they got that idea from. It is not Crysis but I would not say it was ugly. The graphics were fine for me. I am sure they will add more textures later as they did with the dinos. Turn everything up on high if you have a good rig. If it is on sale definately give it a try. If it is not I still say give it a go. It has coop so why not? I have yet to play with my son this week so I'll probably have more to say about my experience with this game at a later date.


This is part 2 of my first update:

If you want a good pvp game this is not the game for you unless you have a large party of people to enter your server and fight each other. I don't even know why people would want this to be pvp.

For those who like to hunt:  This is game is great for the patient person. Why? because it takes a lot of time to hunt in this game if you want to survive. You can not just run around and expect to live, especially solo. It is ideal and preferred (in my opinion) to have a person or more with you on your hunt but not necessary. Carefully go around and collect the weapons and gear from as many boxes as you can (which could take a while) and then find your ideal hunting spot where access to you is as limited as possible or you have some shielding if a dino makes it to your location which right now will be most of the time. Soloing a T-Rex is possible but be sure to have lots of ammo and a good fsr location to pick him off with a rifle with a scope.

Overall the game is hard and can be frustrating if you are ina hurry and the game needs tweaking badly but it does work well enough if you are careful and have hours to collect weapons and then log off and get back on find a good spot and do your killing. There are guides posted on the discussion boards if you need a walkthrough although I have never read them so I do not know how they are helpful.

Patience and weapon supply is key to this game. Practice as much as possible to get use to all of your resources and the mechanics of the game. This is my fairly lame review.

If you get the game on sale it is well worth it in my opinion as you can start local servers as far as I know for friends or play it by yourself. Ark and some of the other games are not really realistic but this is close and needs tweaking as i said.

Part 3 of my review now into the game 900+ hours.

All I have to say is look at my screenshots and my Youtube videos to get your own opinion.

Part 4

In my opinion most of the glitches that people have been experiencing most commonly before the last patch are because people have horrible servers, ISP, or a crappy computer.  Why do I say this? Because I have played over 1000 hours and have played with friends a lot of times and rarely do we have lots" of glitches. We for the most part have a smooth run. My videos will testify to this and keep in mind I did not film all 1000 hours of gameplay. You will see some glitches but they are trivial to me and actually make the game more interestingly difficult imo most times. The game is worth the 9.99 sale right now and 19.99 regular imo. Remember it is a hunting game and not run and gun.

They just had a patch in December and some things may be glitchy again. The Devs said they will be actively working out the bugs. So I will not complain and just say thank you. Please do the same.

Happy Hunting !!!"

reviewText:
I got this game in a bundle, but it would still be well worth $10.

It has a top notch immersive environment with a full day/night cycle as well as weather effects. The sound design is absolutely amazing and you will feel yourself in a pristine island. The calls of dinosaurs in the distance, or the rustling of leaves in the foliage, or the ominous steady stomps from T-rexes are just a few of the environmental surround that you will experience.

There are weapon crates scattered all over the island, but these are still a bit scarce. This is the first game to actually give me a survival-feel that are absent in most open world survival/apocalypse games. The dinosaurs are scarce too, or will feel like it until you learn to notice footprints and the small darting movements from the corner of your eyes in thick jungles.

Two negatives I want to address. The island is freaking big but you travel really slow. That does add immersion but also adds tediousness. I recommend getting a trainer that gives unlimited sprint (but even that is slow).
The second is that the devs abandoned the game. So what you experience the first 10 hours will probably be just about everything the game has to offer in terms of novelty.

I would still recommend it, if you're into an immersive game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Basically you're trying to be eaten by dinosaurs as rarely as possible, so you can sit your character down in a bush, go to bed and the game will play itself overnight.

After a read through the manual and 20 minutes of walking, desperate to track down some dinosaurs to avoid, I had been presented with no trace or sound of anything dinosauric, and had found a single crate containing 2 health potions. My adventures were eventually brought to a white-knuckle climax when my path was blocked by a body of water too watery for even my heroic pioneer to consider. He could sprint for only 5 seconds before succumbing to exhaustion, so perhaps he was not the most bouyant of heroes.

Fortunately there's an auto-walk key, so I can be off manicuring my toes while my hero wanders the terrain in search of house-sized carnivores he doesn't want to be anywhere near, happens across loot crates left in tree stumps by mischievous leprechauns, gets eaten by the carnivores, pretends he's lost any SPAS-12s he could've received from the leprechauns and starts all over again, all with the press of a button!

One of the most convenient games on the market.

reviewText:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Eat.

reviewText:
Survival isn't easy at the best of times, even less so against ravenous Dinosaurs. So don't expect an easy ride here.
There are a number of complaints I'm seeing in the review that suggest to me that most people are out of their comfort zones with this game.

I'll say this; This game is awesome and compelling but not the sort of thing you should expect to be great at right away!
When I first began I got mauled by a T-rex within about an hour. Then I met the Raptors and got eaten alive. Slowly but surely I got the hang of the noises they make, their movement patterns and how to use my inventory effectively.
I treated it like a Rogue-like and got better as I went on, I'm now playing on a file where I'm armed to the teeth and still going after several hours of surviving! It feels great to have gotten to this stage.

I don't usually do this but I'll lay out a few pros and cons for this game as there are a few things I feel could use some polish to really put the cherry on this tasty Dino-cake;

Pros:
1) Huge, lush, GORGEOUS environment with varied lighting and weather.
2) Intelligent, smoothly animated Dinos with unique features and weak points.
3) Easy to use inventory system
4) Feathered, (almost) accurate dinosaurs! At last!
5) Raptor selfies! (Trophy shot option)

Cons and nitpicks:
1) Some dodgy sound transitions, especially when approaching the beach. The ocean sounds don't fade in very well.
2) Online features could be better implemented. Not a huge problem for me though as I prefer to play solo anyway!
3) NOT ENOUGH DINOSAUR SPECIES!! Come on guys, this is my main complaint.
I love this experience as it is but seriously; ONE herbivore type? Hell just stick some un-killable Sauropods in there if you must but please add some more to the roster. T-rex and two types of Raptor is challenging and cool but again a bit more variety would be nice.

So, in conclusion:
This is a great survival game if you can cope with its tough difficulty curve. It's a genuine pleasure to master it but time and patience is required; for tough-guy shooty action, look elsewhere.
I can't think of a better single player Dinosaur experience on Steam at the moment and my only reall issue is with the severely limited variety of Dinosaurs in the game.
Add some more herbivores and perhaps one new mid-sized carnivore and this would be a must -have.
[EDIT] With reguards to 'Game breaking bugs' people have found so far, it's poor form for a dev to have left so many in there at release. However, my review doesn't mention them as I have had the good fortune not to have encountered any of them in my playthroughs!
This review is my opinion based on my experiences playing the game, if you don't like it, that's cool. You'll have to excuse my ''Glass half full'' attitude.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What I think personally?
This is a really great game, with some smart ideas and good gameplay.

This game is better playing with friends but the multiplayer setup is way to confusing to understand (at least for me).

even though its in Early Access people still tend to complain about the most stupidest things, like bugs/glitches and other ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and how dinosaurs can kill you so easily.
THEIR ♥♥♥♥ING DINOSAURS WHAT DID YOU EXPECT, you can't just go running up to one with a gun, shot it and expect it to die insistently.

Aspects:
-Its a game where you have to be stealthy and really have to listen (so its best to play with a good headset) and YOU don't want to make too much noise (such as running) near a Dino, because it will hear you. because of   this it really adds to the atmosphere and the environment, and what you would most probably to in a situation like that.

-The Dinosaurs are pretty good, since the game is early access there are only a couple of Dino species in the game, Each Dino has a weak point (being the heart and ♥♥♥♥) attacking there does more damage then attacking like the side or neck.
they can be a pain to kill but once you do. you get that feeling of accomplishment.

-The weapons are alright, you'll be lucky to find a big crate containing a weapon or clothes?
But mostly you get ammo for the gun you haven't found, but the weapons do some good damage, just make sure you aim at the right areas of the dinosaurs to do MORE damage.

-The map, Oh Boy, THE MAP IS ♥♥♥♥ING AMAZING, its huge it has amazing looks and landmarks ^-^
The only downside to the map is climbing up slopes, they can be really steep and if you climb up a mountain, half way it will become too steep and you can't climb any further. Plus you can take fall damage from sliding down slops so watch out

- Loot Crates do spawn all around the map, and there's certain areas where good loot spawns.
Loot mostly contains:
Weapons
Clothes
Ammo
Health

Final:
As i said the game is still in early access so not everything is in the game, but it still is a great game to play

Final-Final:
So is this  a good game to buy and play: YES
It is worth the $20 you stole

Early Access Review

Yes, I do recomend this game but there are a few thing's that are cool

Good
Fun to roam around with some friend's and loot
Great graphics in my opinon
Love the theme.
It's fun all around.

Bad
-The Utahraptor's alway's seem to stay in the same area that your in. I know that they can smell and everything. But it doesn't really help sitting in a tree Prone for like 30 mins just to walk around and do the same thing.
-The T-Rex seems to be a ninja some time's just randomly knowing where your at.
-I like the bow and everything but it' not that good. I can see that you dont want it to be too OP. But when you first play the game and the raptor's or the T-Rex's are right next to you it does not help. Please at least give is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ pistol with the bow so we have somthing to fall back on.
-When some one disconects it shows the annoying black screen and wont let you play until they disconnected fully.
-Some time's when you pull out your PDA, or look in your inventory it will crash your game.
-Also one more thing to add is that I dont think the stamina recharges fast enough when your walking I get where that's coming from but still. I could run around stop for about 20 seconds while walking and be able to run again another mile.

I still love this game even if this happens. I have the highest of hopes for this game. Can't wait and see what you guy's do next.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, some devs got drunk, talked about how bored they were working on TheHunter for three years straight and came up with an idea to make the hunters the hunted. Laughs were had, someone drew a T-Rex on a napkin and here we are. What was on the napkin is now executed: You can use all the mechanics from TheHunter to make your way across a jungle island. But once you find something it will kill you, instead of the other way around. And that's all there is to it. You just wander through the endless green, trying to find gear, and then you die. And again. And again. There is no story arc, no greater goal to aspire to, nothing much else to do.

If you like the scenery and the hunting, try TheHunter. If you like the survival aspect, try Rust. If you want to be two years ahead of a possible release of a dino hunting game, jump into the repetetive vegetation of Primal. And die. And die. And die.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is called theHunter: primal, I play the orginal game, theHunter, was really thinking game would invovle actual hunting some dinos, kinda like Jurassic Park 2, dangerous as hell but still hunting.

However, this game involves very little hunting, you start with a longbow and have to crawl around hoping that you stumble upon a crate with a firearm, although, even then ammo is pretty rare so even then you cant do any proper hunting since on your own you have a hard time taking out anything  besides the smallest dinos, and a solo roaming dino here and there. This shouldnt be called theHunter, since there is very little actual hunting in it, theSurvivor would be a better name.
If that is your cup of tea, go ahead, you might like it, I got fooled by the name and thinking it was like the original game, a hunting game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The most realistic dino surviving game to date.  Not for your run-n-gun type player.  It takes patience and planning when hunting or evading.  I do not see it so much as a hunting game but rather as a survival game.  Your odds of surviving go up tremendously when you have a companion with you.  The sounds are amazing on headphones and really immerse you into the game.  I know there are still tweaks to the sounds as some pings on containers are not correct and you get sound drops during rain storms.

Utahraptors, velociraptors, and tri's all interact and react well  when attacking and being shot.  The T-Rex I have not figured out yet.  I have killed several throughout the changes and thank goodness the population was decreased some; however, I am still finding multiple in a common areas, which really makes it tough to escape or hunt.  Their vision is incredible (too good) and I do not see them fleeing when shot. They seem to continue to attack you until they are finally dead.

I like the tweaks to the weapons and the opportunity to purchase a weapon at the start upon reaching the right level.  The Bow can be effective it just takes some time on learning to aim it properly based on distance to target.

I would like to see more interaction between the dino's especially when there are multiple T-Rex. Interaction between Triceratops and T-Rex, Pack of Utahs and T-Rex, and Utah's vs Utahs when in different packs.  They should be more territorial areas to develop this interaction. I am still looking forward to more dinos being introduced.

Additional Game play comments:
I don't like that you can only see 250 m with marksman scope, past that range the humans, dinos disappear but all the vegetation and land looks the same.    If it's due to a range issue with the gun you should just show the shot dropping and hitting before the animal.  I often use it to scan a valley to search for dinos before proceeding but then when I think it is clear a T-Rex will suddenly appear.

Equipment could include a tree stand, however, the height allowed would have to be limited keeping you vulnerable to Utahs and T-Rex.

Instead of a red screen at your death, you could show a more animated death from the attacker in a 3rd person view.  And while you wait your 10 seconds you could watch them eat your body.

Really Enjoying the game!   Keep up the development, the price is a steal at the early release price, when finished it surely will increase and still be well worth the cost.

reviewText: Don't buy. Don't give them your money. Looks like another cash grab. So dissapointed as I really did think it would turn out half ok. Now its only half a game in my opinion. But with 'The Hunter:Primal' I feel I just have to warn people away from purchasing this game.  Maybe that shows the dissapointment I feel towards it. Up until a few days ago this wasn't a finished game. They release a new flying sh*$ty bird dinosaur and they seem to think 'its ready, yes, lets realease this. People will love this'. Dinosaurs

reviewText:
This game is alot of fun,especially with 3-6 or more players. However, when there are that many players competing for the sparse amount of ammo it presents an unwanted competition. I suggest creating another way to obtain ammo,(other than dying or commiting suicide). Either by reward or allowing players to use their EG's to buy it. Increasing the amounts of ammo found in boxes would help. I, and all my friends that play, have dropped the .50 cal because there isn't enough ammo. A token or or some other unique pouch, case,crate etc. to allow a player to create ammo would be a bonus.

Happy Dino Hunting......

reviewText:
Had to change the Review from thumbs down to thumbs up... because even with its flaws, the game is damn addicting and relaxing
well, i say it how it is,

the game has a lot of potential, but sadly its a mess full of bugs and glitches.

+ huge gaming world, some nice visuals, a few good weapons and you can change your clothes
+multiplayer actually works, even thought there arent many servers and the playerbase seems to be rather small.

- the graphics engine looks dated, many video and animation glitches, the gaming world is very big, but the amount of dinos is pretty low.
- sometimes you walk like 30 minutes without seeing any lifeforms.
- dinos can get stuck, walk up glitchy trees...
- variety of dinosaurs is also very small. i would love to see many more species


when i take a look at the forum, it seems like the developers abandoned the game already. hopefully im wrong and we will be seing new content in the future.

the problems that the game has could be fixed within a few weeks, with fixing bugs and glitches, adding much more wildlife, but at the moment it doesnt seem like anyone actually cares anymore.


TL;DR: with a few changes it could be a masterpiece, but its already very addicting

reviewText:
This is awsome looking game and the concept is very fun.

-BUT-

There is one GLARING flaw, you start from scatch EVERY TIME you get killed, and after about 5 or so times, this gets very old. It is like a perma-death setting that is very unforgiving. You travel across miles of landscape and collect lots of gear and weapons with much effort and get killed, or eaten only to find yourself placed in a random spot on the map with nothing.

Granted, you can buy things with your points, but it is not the same. If they only would give us the ability to go back to a previous save game, it would make the game much less frustrating and enjoyable.

If you spend hours and miles of map space collecting gear and uncovering the map only to die and loose it all, well after a while you figure what's the point, even when you exit and come back you find yourself somewhere else from where you left off.

reviewText: There really should be a third option for whether or not you recommend the game. That third option should be 'Meh'.\nI do enjoy playing this game but I find myself spending more time retrieveing my corpses than I do hunting. Hence, spending most of your time retrieving your corpse to recover any decent weapons you've already found. I really don't see myself playing this game long enough to hit level 30 as it is now.

reviewText:
{ A big pre-review what to expect in the game }

First time i bought this game i quited in RAGE just because i didnt understand it. But after giving it 5th try i saw LOVE in my eyes. This game is so hard but so rewarding when you do your first kill of a Raptor, Rex or any other dinos in the world. Sneaking following trails with your ipod-map (not sure what to call it really lol but its your best friend) is so scary sometimes when you can hear a REX or Raptor closing in.

This game is all about survival in a land where dinos rule land and air. So being a hunter you are also the hunted. This game is by no reason EASY it shuldnt its all about survival in the unfriendly island as a hunter.

You start by landing by a pod randomly each time on the island. You start only with a machette and a uncovered map. So the first goal is to search for hidden chests in old bases or randomly placed over island. Do note that you will not allways find a weapon or ammo. Somtiems its just a map fragment or cammo clothes.

If you are lucky you will find pistols,  rifles, bows, small bit of ammo and even health if you are lucky. The most important many seems to forget is that there is cammo clothes. They can make big impact how long you can survive. Crawling with a cammo can manke life changes many times when predators are close by.

The only negative i have to say is that I dont understand why you cant jump up on cliffs or any other stuff like on bases roof? I would love if there was some sort of safe areas where you could SAVE your loot and equipments. Now you have to quit game for it to save it. Safe areas could also be used to discuss with all other human hunters in your game. Plan a REX hunt or any other specified animal. This could then be setup by a ADMIN if there was such controlls.

End words, you get the most out of this game by playing online with friends. Singleplayer can be SAFE but its way harder. The forum community shines. So dont be affraid to ask anything.

GFx: 9-10
SFx: 8-10
Gameplay: 7-10 (why cant you JUMP?)

Scary YES worth it YES. Recommended all the way. Go for it!.. I still sleep with eyes WIDE open after hearing loud footsteps lol  :)
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Possibly the worst game I've ever played. Hours of walking, minimal interaction with ANY environment, low dino spawn rate (like next to no sightings for 30+ minutes of walking/sprinting), and the general feel that this game was just a quick cash grab. I, for one, regret donating money early hoping to get this awesome-sounding, yet ultimately disappointing game off the ground.\n\nI'd like my $ back
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I started playing this game a few weeks ago and began liking it. The game is enjoyable in single player or multiplayer and the progression of items and levelling provides incentives for progression. The difficulty is a strong draw for me (though other players may not like intense difficulty).

However, the numerous string of bugs that have gone on unfixed (after reading well before I started playing) is frustrating. Of note the recurring issues I experienced were: inventory items not saving, level progression not being saved, frequent game crashes/false starts. More frustrating however is the reaction the devs have to constructive feed back - no responses/acknowledgements nor plans for fixes. The patches target minor glitches that rarely negatively impact the player base -or- increase content. Content increases aren't a bad thing at all, but when there are no published plans or discussions for fixing major game issues it's a problem because it indicates that fixing major issues is not a priority.

Further, it appears that efforts to discuss these issues are censored from their discussion forums as numnerous posts I have made (and others read) were subsequently deleted within a day of writing. The posts were professional and constructive in nature and contained no derrogatory language.

Note: The discussion forums are moderated to not allow negative discussion of game facets (even in a professional and constructive manner).

reviewText: It was a fun game when I first started playing, but that quickly changed.  The controls are severely limiting, basically not allowing you to point shoot, and locking you in place, or to a slow crawl while you gradually aim your weapon.  It's fine to aim, but sometimes, a raptor is close enough to you that it's not necesary, and quite fatal to aim, for you that is.   I feel like they based the controls on what some fat chair jockey programming all day is capable of doing.  If that's the goal, you've achieved it quite well because I have never felt like such a slow sluggish out of shape fat man in my entire life.  They did some great stuff with this game, but sadly, were not ambitious enough.  They could have included a dozen more species of dinosaur, but they stopped at what I'm supposing were their favorites.  They could have enabled you to interact with some of the dinosaurs in other ways than killing them, such as riding a triceratops.  It takes some time to get around the map since you have to walk everywhere, and it is quite dangerous.  Maybe a vehicle of some sort would have been good.  In all, this game didn't quite achieve what I hoped for.  I would recommend playing Ark: Survival Evolved instead, if you like dinosaurs. It's much more fun, much more ambitious, has WAAAAAAAY more dinosaurs... and it's got a lot more things to do.

reviewText: This is the only decent dinosaur hunting/survival game ever released. I especially applaud the developer for giving the dinos feathers which no other developer dared to do. I can highly recommend this game to all dinosaur lovers with a bit of patience. The game is certainly far away from mainstream gaming which I guess is why it has so many bad reviews. This is the game to go for if you want a marginally realistic dinosaur hunting game, no other game comes even close.

reviewText:
Skyrim w/ Dinos!

Seriously, this game is like waaaaaaay better than ARK.  Don't get me wrong, I love ARK but it just takes too long to accomplish much of anything in that game and the real fun *exploring and hunting dinos* (at least for me) is almost entirely overshadowed by the need to craft a bow and arrows and other weapons everytime I die and need to go on the hunt again when i spawn back in, almost guaranteeing the necessity for multiplayer/tribe forming gameplay.  Now enter tH:P...

No crafting, no dying from exposure to the elements or from hunger/thirst and a leveling system that is beautiful in its simplicity - hunt dinos and you level up a little and acquire cash monies as well!! As you level you'll gain access to weapons and clothing, as well as some items, that will aid you in your quest to track down and kill as many dinos as possible. Plus you can find stuff in supply crates. What's more, the island environment looks pretty convincing, even from a great distance, the day/night cycle is realistically long, the weather effects/clouds are great, namely the sky (which I think is one of the best looking/convincing ones I've ever seen in a game) and the weapon/item selection is decent which overall makes for a very pleasant and satisfying gaming experience.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't worry it doesn't have the same micro transactions as theHunter does. It's a one-time payment with no purchasing of guns in a store for real money.

The game in its current state seems alright. It has some connectivity issues and some crashing. These are to be expected in an early alpha build.

There are only 3 species to hunt atm, Triceratops, T-rex and Raptors. The AI seems to be iffy at times. They will stand around taking shots before they start attacking you or they will just out right not see you sometimes. But when the AI works it's terrifying. The raptors hunt in packs, both the T-rex and raptor will stalk you.

The survival aspect isn't much yet. You don't have to worry about starvation or thirst. You can't craft weapons or anything yet. You basically survive by not being eaten. But they could extend on this as time goes on.

If you are the least bit interested in a Dino hunting/survival game give this game a shot.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To the survivor who isn't dead yet...

The forest was dense, very dense. The grass itself was at my waist, the bushes a sprawling wall of green and the trees...I feel so small on this planet. Small and insignificant. My first feeling is fear, I could almost smell it on myself. The sparse yellow outfit I was provided feels severley unquipped for the rigors of this harsh world. This was only  compounded by the fact that they felt it was suitable to equip me with a wooden bow and some arrows...have they ever crouched in a bush, the yellow of their outfit stained a filthy brown as they ♥♥♥♥ themselves in pure and utter terror, my bodies defensive response to a T-Rex not 3m from me, its nostrils flaring as it snorted the air...I'm surprised it didn't smell my fear let alone my pile of ♥♥♥♥. Then again, there was a pile of its own ♥♥♥♥ just beyond us. Yes. Fear is all I know of this planet. I clung to that bush for dear life, even when the creature disappeared over the ridge, I sat crying at the bush. Time just went on by...and god knows what other creatures of death. I eventually slinked back to my landing pod, my one and only small measure of secuirty and safety. I write this now at the peak of the volcano...that was quite a trek. I haven't seen a dinosaur since that moment with the T-Rex. Despite this fact, every step, every step forward is pure terror. I can't see anything yet I hear EVERYTHING. The rustles, the groans and screeches, the distant roars...this place, I just...back home life is as many people would expect, happiness, friends and families. These are the norm. Here, on what I've dubbed a Green Vegetated Hell I only know fear, you will only know fear. You will never see them, you will just hear them. You will never out run them, they will just catch you. You will never survive...they will just kill you. Your no Primal Hunter. You're the hunted. You will learn that or you will die. Its not you surviving, your already dead. They just haven't found you yet. Trust me. They will find you.

From a survivor who is dead

Alright guys, first things first. Yes this is an early access game, remember that. Always when buying such games. Lets get into this.

For an early access game this game is in quite a good state and stands on very promising ground to deliver an exceptional title. I love my survival games and ones with dinosaurs, vast maps and huge forests just grab my attention. This is definitely the best survival dino game I've played. There is definitely limited content to the game atm. There are only three dinos in the game atm and as of this moment I'm still unable to play multiplayer. Depspite this, god I've had some fun. Yes that first little letter is some roleplaying but that is honestly my first experience in the game. I survived for quite a while, imo anyway lol. This game is very beautiful, absolutely huge and completely terrifying early on. You're so insignifcant its not funny. You're hopeless against their attacks so all you can do in sneak and slink around gathering supplies and creating an arsenal. So during this time you explore much of the terrain, see much of how the dinos act as you sit there and watch. You survive. Barely.

So rather than blabbering I'll list some pros and cons.

Pros/Awesome stuff:
Dinosaurs...big ones
Huge and I mean huge map that is intricately detailed and beautiful. Love it.
Presence. This game has presence. It has atmosphere. You're so small and helpless and you know it. This is done through the environment, the detail of it all, the atmospheric sounds of you creeping through the bushes, the call of all the dinos and the terrifying attacks of the dinos.
Tracking a wounded dino...pretty fun in such a hostile environment. Killing it is even better.
Its muliplayer capability is huge, I can't wait to get into some games. To track a T-Rex with a team and take down such a beast, definitely looking forward to it.
The fact that your not the hunter, your the hunted. Never forget that, everything can change instantly.
The enormous potential this game has. Giant sauropods roaming through the forest, a stampede of herbivores as they are chased by a T-Rex, the potential is just endless.

Theres more and I could go on but you get the idea.

Cons:
I think weapons are a little too weak. Shot a raptor 4 times in the head with a bow, didn't die. Five shots with a shotgun...this game isn't meant to be played solo, the damage is proportional for groups of players not solo players. Remember that always.
Not too much to do atm. I don't see this as a con as this is early  access its to be expected but people need to be aware of the state of the game atm. You need to be informed of such a thing. Not much to atm BUT down the road, ♥♥♥♥ yea.
The stamina system, your like a morbidly obese person. Can't run much and you can't run far. Needs to change. Trust me, if you had a T-Rex on your ♥♥♥ you'd make Usain Bolt look slow. Btw you can't outrun one lmao

Thats all I really have a problem with if you could call it that. Just things that you WILL encounter and perhaps need some changing.

Things I'd like to see though:
More dinos
Crafting of any sort. Weapons, backpacks, houses, !!TRAPS!!! like deadfall traps etc etc, would be cool.
Ability to capture dinosaurs. Would be cool. To capture a dinosaur. On the island there is what used to be a base surrounded by wooden spikes with two towers...I'd make this place into a dino arena. Thats just me lol
I'm unaware as to the variety of weapons available but perhaps a larger variety. Tranq guns, lmgs, flamethrowers.
In the crafting systems have skinng possible, ability to use their carcasses.


Yes I know this is a title from a company that makes hunting games, yet this game can be turned into something a little but more than a 'hunting' game. If that is simply the end game scope for this game, simply bagging kills then that would kill the game for me. It would be such an anti-climax. This game has huge potential. Please don't waste it.

The forest was dense, very dense. The grass itself was at my waist, the bushes a sprawling wall of green and the trees...I feel so small on this planet. Small and insignificant. My first feeling is fear, I could almost smell it on myself. The sparse yellow outfit I was provided feels severley unquipped for the rigors of this harsh world. This was only  compounded by the fact that they felt it was suitable to equip me with a wooden bow and some arrows...have they ever crouched in a bush, the yellow of their outfit stained a filthy brown as they ♥♥♥♥ themselves in pure and utter terror, my bodies defensive response to a T-Rex not 3m from me, its nostrils flaring as it snorted the air...I'm surprised it didn't smell my fear let alone my pile of ♥♥♥♥. Then again, there was a pile of its own ♥♥♥♥ just beyond us. Yes. Fear is all I know of this planet. I clung to that bush for dear life, even when the creature disappeared over the ridge, I sat crying at the bush. Time just went on by...and god knows what other creatures of death. I eventually slinked back to my landing pod, my one and only small measure of secuirty and safety. I write this now at the peak of the volcano...that was quite a trek. I haven't seen a dinosaur since that moment with the T-Rex. Despite this fact, every step, every step forward is pure terror. I can't see anything yet I hear EVERYTHING. The rustles, the groans and screeches, the distant roars...this place, I just...back home life is as many people would expect, happiness, friends and families. These are the norm. Here, on what I've dubbed a Green Vegetated Hell I only know fear, you will only know fear. You will never see them, you will just hear them. You will never out run them, they will just catch you. You will never survive...they will just kill you. Your no Primal Hunter. You're the hunted. You will learn that or you will die. Its not you surviving, your already dead. They just haven't found you yet. Trust me. They will find you.

From a survivor who is dead

Alright guys, first things first. Yes this is an early access game, remember that. Always when buying such games. Lets get into this.

For an early access game this game is in quite a good state and stands on very promising ground to deliver an exceptional title. I love my survival games and ones with dinosaurs, vast maps and huge forests just grab my attention. This is definitely the best survival dino game I've played. There is definitely limited content to the game atm. There are only three dinos in the game atm and as of this moment I'm still unable to play multiplayer. Depspite this, god I've had some fun. Yes that first little letter is some roleplaying but that is honestly my first experience in the game. I survived for quite a while, imo anyway lol. This game is very beautiful, absolutely huge and completely terrifying early on. You're so insignifcant its not funny. You're hopeless against their attacks so all you can do in sneak and slink around gathering supplies and creating an arsenal. So during this time you explore much of the terrain, see much of how the dinos act as you sit there and watch. You survive. Barely.

So rather than blabbering I'll list some pros and cons.

Pros/Awesome stuff:
Dinosaurs...big ones
Huge and I mean huge map that is intricately detailed and beautiful. Love it.
Presence. This game has presence. It has atmosphere. You're so small and helpless and you know it. This is done through the environment, the detail of it all, the atmospheric sounds of you creeping through the bushes, the call of all the dinos and the terrifying attacks of the dinos.
Tracking a wounded dino...pretty fun in such a hostile environment. Killing it is even better.
Its muliplayer capability is huge, I can't wait to get into some games. To track a T-Rex with a team and take down such a beast, definitely looking forward to it.
The fact that your not the hunter, your the hunted. Never forget that, everything can change instantly.
The enormous potential this game has. Giant sauropods roaming through the forest, a stampede of herbivores as they are chased by a T-Rex, the potential is just endless.

Theres more and I could go on but you get the idea.

Cons:
I think weapons are a little too weak. Shot a raptor 4 times in the head with a bow, didn't die. Five shots with a shotgun...this game isn't meant to be played solo, the damage is proportional for groups of players not solo players. Remember that always.
Not too much to do atm. I don't see this as a con as this is early  access its to be expected but people need to be aware of the state of the game atm. You need to be informed of such a thing. Not much to atm BUT down the road, ♥♥♥♥ yea.
The stamina system, your like a morbidly obese person. Can't run much and you can't run far. Needs to change. Trust me, if you had a T-Rex on your ♥♥♥ you'd make Usain Bolt look slow. Btw you can't outrun one lmao

Thats all I really have a problem with if you could call it that. Just things that you WILL encounter and perhaps need some changing.

Things I'd like to see though:
More dinos
Crafting of any sort. Weapons, backpacks, houses, !!TRAPS!!! like deadfall traps etc etc, would be cool.
Ability to capture dinosaurs. Would be cool. To capture a dinosaur. On the island there is what used to be a base surrounded by wooden spikes with two towers...I'd make this place into a dino arena. Thats just me lol
I'm unaware as to the variety of weapons available but perhaps a larger variety. Tranq guns, lmgs, flamethrowers.
In the crafting systems have skinng possible, ability to use their carcasses.


Yes I know this is a title from a company that makes hunting games, yet this game can be turned into something a little but more than a 'hunting' game. If that is simply the end game scope for this game, simply bagging kills then that would kill the game for me. It would be such an anti-climax. This game has huge potential. Please don't waste it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As you can see I have little time in-game, I wil tell you why.

I spawn, instantly notice a beautiful game, not just with looks but total immersion, sound and sight.

I find a box, nice some rounds and some med kits.

Notice mountian/volcano, go for a small walk up said hill.

Find a lovley base at top, with some clothing and two 12g shotguns, but no ammo, damn.

Path leads to dead end, head back down, not the way I came, just incase I am being followed.

I then get to a massive tree, like huge, notice other trees, appreciate the effort gone into the wildlife etc. in the game.

fine a hide-ie-hole in one of the big trees, I think its awesome, so cool infact I step inside.

Look around, nothing, go back outside.

I am confronted by a T-Rex, slowly backed into said hide-ie-hole.

He leaves, I try to mak a break for it, notice a tail hanging from a bush, look round.

Bam, Raptor to the face.

Honestly the best introduction to a game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This has so much potential to be a truly great game but it has quite a ways to go, which I will get to.

The atmosphere is fantastic even though I've spent most of the game alone trying to reach other survivors. You can sprint but it's loud so you have to desperately take your time and on the rare chance that you do meet up with someone, the feeling is great because you are two, now. The map is large but not infinite, allowing you to reach other players if you can survive the trek. It can be scary at times, when you're crouched next to a bush hearing something far off coming closer. Trying to guage where it's coming from. And how many they are. Very tense moments, like the first time you see a Rex from far off.

The game does change a bit once you find a gun or two. I know it's a hunting game but when all you have is 5 bows, you aren't hunting anymore. You're fleeing to the safety of other players and the slim chance of good luck along the way.

There are things that I love about this game. The 8 year old in me that still loves dinosaurs more than anything else loves the bejesus out this game. But there are some issues.

The crashing is still bad. That is going to need to improve quickly. It's hard to develop a rhythym when players are constantly getting dropped. I'm on win8.1 and I'm not lagging. But it still crashes all the time.

The other big issue and I swear it's not because I'm bad, but the aiming mechanism is awful. Bowhunting" is nearly impossible. The guns are a lottle bit better because you don't have to draw them back but it still ain't great. The game gets choppy to the point of death. And then you respawn all the way across the map and have to sneak
recommended: and walk a good 4000m to reach the other players. The game has a way of spreading you all out .\n\nSo. It has amaing potential but right now

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros
-Amazing scenery, graphics
-Dinosaur AI is fantastic (Raptors hunt you down in packs)
-Not too hard to find weapons
-Giant Map
-Has some player customisation

Cons
-Buggy (first day in early access, will get better)
-only 3 types of dinos (will get more)
-only a few guns(will get more)

All in all, i would recommend this game. While there are some bugs, It's very playable.  While the dinosaurs are pretty hard to kill, that's to be expected, considering the skin of one is almost an inch thick, plus the bones are thick as well.
It's possible to kill the UtahRaptor with just one arrow (through one lung even).
I would rate this game a 6/10 at this stage, considering it's its first day. I expect many updates from the Dev team, and this game to get much better.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As a lover of TheHunter, I have to say I am dissapointed so far with this. TheHunter is a game that you can take slow, enjoy stalking prey and bring your own weapons to the field. What I loved about TheHunter is I can play by myself if I wish, and all I have to do if I need to pause game is bring up menu screen.... I understand during multiplayer this cannot happen BUT I do NOT play multiplayer. Being able to pause is very useful with a toddler and a baby in the house.

Now my huge gripe... as I see so far, this game is totaly NOT solo friendly. I have played for hours, have found many backpacks and such to open, and all I get is a bow. I had a shotgun for 2 seconds before a Trex got me. So now all I have is a bow, and a couple arrows. First, after running around for 15 mins I see no dinos.... at all. The only animal that wont instantly attack me runs from me. I got a lung/heart shot on it with a bow and it ran a quarter of the map and never died, shot it two more times before I gave up. Doc would be ashamed! The second dino which I can kill, runs in packs..... and then the third dino all I see in desription is, dont hunt it alone..... So Tri/dont take down easy dont hunt alont, Raptor/runs in packs dont take along, Trex/dont take alone... I mean come on!!!

Many other small issues so far, like arrows not combining when you find them. I still have yet to harvest my first kill... even with lung/heart shots... I just dont know..... I do however recomend TheHunter for people who like slow paced hunting games that are semi realistic.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First Impressions:

The ambience and scenery are nice, though they could admittedly be a bit better and more realistic.  At present there are only three dinosaurs with two more coming...not exactly a wide variety.  In addition to more dinosaur types, I'd like to see a survival element added to the game (hunger, thirst, etc.) that could be toggled on or off since some hate mixing and matching hunting and survival.  The stamina bar runs out a bit too quickly for my taste as the average human being can sprint longer than say, two to three seconds.  With all of that said, the idea of hunting dinos is a rather appealing notion and I can't wait to see what else gets added over the course of development.  The price will increase at launch, so either buy it now or wait for a sale if money is tight.

reviewText:
As early access, this game was great.  Updates kept adding good things to the game, like new weapons, better dino behaviors and looks, the leveling system, etc.  It was shaping up to something good.  Then they decided to declare it done and release it... and added quetzalcoatlus.

Quetzalcoatlus is just buggy as hell, ridiculously overpowered and aggressive, hovers over everything and anything of importance, and it clips through the ground to pick you up, making it impossible to shoot at it as it comes down to swoop you off [you have a limit of how far you can aim up and down].
Just... avoid it.  Avoid it at all cost.  If you do feel adventurous, then wait for it to be on sale.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game from am obscure publisher that mainly makes hunting games. The game runs great on my rig at maximum and looks fantastic. The dinos movement is realistic and they look like massive predators. Guns handle well, and sound realistic.

Though there are a few things i would like to see implamented.

1)Base/Camp building. Setting down tents for storage, and perhaps sonic emitters to keep away dinos. Wooden barricades to keep out pesky thieves. Trips wires and more.

2) A more informative/User friendly UI and Inventory. Perhaps a grid inventory system.

3) Group creation on PVP servers.

4) Hunger/Thirst implamamentation.

Right now they have the workings of DayZ but it seems half hearted like they dove into the genre because its popular not because they know exactly what there doing. I could be wrong and it could be a big surprise hit. But for right now its a decent game, and fun to watch friends be mauled and shook around like a chew toy when the Rex catches their scent.

reviewText:
I have 46 hours logged on this game, so I can't say it's terrible. But I'm always wanting more from it, not just variety in dinosaurs but in gameplay aspects. There's nothing beyond get a gun and kill dinosaurs. You can skulk around and maybe ambush a few while prone, but that's it. Shoot and kill.

I'd rather them put items like wood to build a tree stand, smoke bomb to escape a raptor attack, decoys to ambush dino's from a distance. I say these things because they seem feasible within the engine. I'll comeback to the gam every few months and go at it for a day or two, then get bored again.

Bottom-Line: If it's less than $10, pick it up. You're fist dino encoutner will be exhilirating. The second will be your practice trials. The third will be taking on a trike probably. And finally you'll take on a rex. After that, the gmae is over.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Well. There are some definate high and low points to this game.

Pros
Gorgeous.
Fun
Huge map
Decent weapon selection
sound effects are great.
people tend to be nice.

Cons
A tad overpriced. However a great buy if its on sale. (i got it in a bundle for 5$)
Kind of a pain to get your own hosted server to work
Game sometimes spawns you over and over by a trex....ouch
While infinitely better than having to buy EVERYTHING with real money like the original, random loots are terrible sometimes when your 1 hit from death and you get 6 boxes with no health items in it and a tiny little dino bites your toe and kills you.

A couple weather bugs where the sun goes all truman show...its not game breaking but it breaks the immersion....though its hillarious to see.

Lacks a fast travel mechanic... which i could do without for taveling...but when spawning it would be appreciated... Like you go to join a server with a friend Oh hey....your.....2 miles that way and im unarmed... takes a while to get to your friends sometimes...

Overall...its quite a fun experience and almost forces you to quite jurassic park atleast once if you like the original or the concept...id highly reccomend picking this game up when its on sale

Overall 7.75/10

reviewText: I cant understand all the negative reviews regarding this game it plays & looks great .Step into a huge Jurassic world, where the very environment will challenge your survival skills, players begin with very limited equipment. You need to explore the island in search of more powerful weapons, clothing and equipment. Sounds easy? Well not only is the island littered with poisonous plants, but deadly dinosaurs that roam the island looking to feast on the weak. Only the foolish will challenge the mighty Tyrannosaur Rex alone. Careful planning, cooperation and backpacks filled with ammo and weapons is needed to bring this beast down. But watch out! The island is also populated with highly intelligent Utahraptors traveling in packs. Like wolves they communicate and work together to bring down a lonely hunter. Make sure to check you six! Want a more peaceful hunt? In that case the Triceratops might be an easier prey.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The hunter primal many words can describe this game but i would like to point out 1 that has this game in 1 word, catastrophic not in a bad way. this game is in early access and has its bugs but when this game works it a catasrphic it has dinos running around killing u killing other people and to be honest .......... I LOVE IT catastrophic is the word because that is how the game is intended to play like EX: this is u starting u hear the faint cherp of something thinking it might be a bird u sprint to were the gps located a base about 4000 meters away u have nothing to fear if this is like the other the hunter game were u dont see a thing for about six hours and then some how it disapears then u should be fine, but its not at all like the other the hunter it is 100X quicker with spotting something. now u hear a growl u hope its ambient but its not so u are cowaring in ur own crap waiting for this moster to stroll off, well it smells u and it is hungry its been hunting all day and the most its gotten was a cricket so it is going to follow u and hunt u till its dead or u are. so u finallly decide ima person i am smart i should be able to kill it, then u step out to find 6 raptors waiting, yep ur screwed  better get back in the tree trunk u were just in ohhh wait they now know ur hiding spot and have found and have killed u now they will have a delisous dinner. next u respawn only theres a  peson next to u they say they want to team and u do and that person leads u to bases u had no idea about so now ur geared in noble hunting clothes and have a shotgun with tons of ammo and a elephant gun(the .700 rifle) and are ready to take on the world of eden, well the world of eden it already knows u want to kill a rex so whats better then to give u 3 ahhhhhh this is ur first time seeing 3 rexes so u hide ur buddy on the other hand runs and lewers 2 of em away ahh theres 1 just there u know u want to so  u shoot this bahemeth of a liizard and realize it gonna take a few shots so u shoot it 1nce more and u hope it goes down but ur luck has run out. u imbasol i shot it in the foot twice and its only 80 meters from u so u pull out ur shotgun in hopes u can make it run away,remember how ur a bad shot well u still are u miss 6 times and u die u rage wuit and realise that game is amazingly catastrophic in the end

As i said before this game is catastrophice at the end this stroy might not happen the same way u might get killed by something else but eventually u will die and it will be a major death that makes u rage quit

I recomend this to all who have patience like fps games and like sitting in there own feases (jk on the feases part) but i will say dont buy it now unless u cant resist wait for the next update when they add there 4th dino

reviewText: This game is like a dream come true for me, after watching Jurassic Park a million times during my childhood, i have always wanted to play a REALISTIC survival game with dinosaurs that made me feel like i was in the movie. I recommend you to wear headphones while playing this game because the sounds are just beautiful like hearing yourself cross a swamp while keeping an eye out for raptors just makes the game intense and realistic. Unfortunatly there are some things that the game lacks like how it only has 1 map, 5 dinos, and 12 or more weapons. Weapons are not really the problem for me, it just needs more dinosaurs and maybe another map. I HOPE that in the future the devs will add more content, other than that I STRONGLY RECOMMEND THIS GAME if you like adventure, hunting, survival, or dinosaurs. By far this is the BEST $12 i have ever spent!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

THIS GAME HAS

a immersive game world
superb graphics
great sound
nice gameplay
great creature models

BUT THIS GAME DESPERATELY NEEDS

a easier way to get into multiplayer games with friends
and less crashing whilst in games that are in progress

Some community as well as player servers. Be wary all people buying this game that
all player multiplay servers die / cease to be when the player who created the server leaves the game. Not good when you have put a lot of time into a game on a server. There is no game save or save on items found.

players need a way to traverse water to waist height or ability to swim in the water.
What is the point of water if it acts like a wall ?

a better way to obtain and maybe craft some weapons

craftable camps or shelters to heal and hide
or just to be safe and chat with fellow players

binoculars > obvious reasons

some sort of shop > but make it like team fortress and not a complete rip off like the hunter is
if this game goes the way the hunter did i will neg the review instantly.

more clothing wandering around in a bright yellow t shirt and half length french pantaloons spolis the mood / immersion. Also everyone right now in game seems to be wearing the same....dull

Maybe some sort of save of some achieved game items. Whats the point in joining a server then building up a weapon arsenal only for the person who created the server to decide to take the server down resulting in you losing everything ? You then have to start from the very beginning again on a new server. Its frustrating and not your fault when this happens. But it feels like you are being penalised.

More Dinosaurs. There arent many at the moment

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Day #1
I find myself on what appears to be a very hostile planet. Equipped with only a bow and a few arrows I set foot to search this strange planet.

What was that? Sounded like a growl... Impossible... Raptor?

But I only have a bow surely this is too weak, I must make a break for the lab! Good maybe I will find something stronger to take out this Raptor and claim my spot as king of this inhospitable planet.



Great game, has some what of a story to it, fun to explore, would be even better with your friends. Being early access there is lots more features to come, you won't be disappointed.

reviewText: Was looking for a dinosaur-themed game to tide me over until the hype of Jurassic World would get some more dinosaur games going. I liked the premise of this game and finally convinced myself to download it, hoping it would fulfill the dinosaur-hunting void in my life. I played this game for about 6 hours before finally rage-quitting. I found the game very frustrating. At times I would be insta-chomped by a tyrannosaurus or pack of utahraptors without any chance of using my weapons In other lives I would be running away like crazy or staring down at a weak little velociraptor thinking about how nice it would be if I had ammunition and could therefore kill the dinosaur before it killed me. The ability to go back to your death-location and recover your weapons was nice, except that the game's respawn point was so far away from where you needed to go. The five minute walk to recover your weapons felt like an hour.\n\nAll I wanted in this game was to kill dinosaurs. I couldn't care less about the survival" aspect of the game. I finally did kill some utah raptors and velociraptors
date: but the amount of effort I was putting was not worth the reward. I thought about recruiting my boyfriend to play with me
recommended: but with the size of the map and the spawn points and death-respawn and all
hoursPlayed:
there is no way we could have physically gotten close enough to each other to play cooperatively.


If you want a dinosaur-themed game
voteText: invest $1 into Orion:Prelude and satisfy your dinosaur-killing urges. And now the trailers for ARK:Survival have come out and I am now in counting down the days until I get to kill dinosaurs AND ride them."

reviewText: Instead of everyone complaining, I have some helpful things to say about the game. I would just like to state that first, the Q's can easily be killed, I killed one in one shot, they can easily be avoided and dodged too, and with the newest update they aren't really a problem anymore, but when you find them still a threat. I think this game could be huge if you update it lots and prove everyone wrong about it. The quality of the scenery is amazing, the sounds are too, there's birds and butterflies flying around, at night it's really sketchy and different, there's crazy storms that happen. I'm a big fan of this game and I have a few suggestions that I think other people will like. Definitely add the ability to swim and jump... those are pretty basic skills for people who just dropped in on pods. I also think you should add crafting, such as traps, and cutting wood, it would be so scary to try and harvest wood sometimes when you need to and who drops into this environment with no survival skills am i right? I feel as if there is a low field of vision, like you can't see dinos farther than a certain distance which makes no sense when you should be able to see them. I'm not sure why none of the dinosaurs attack each other, but I think it would cool if say a T-rex ate a Triceratops, and then after little raptors come in for a meal, because they're scavengers. I'm sure you're working on a lot of things already, but if you aren't I would like to see more guns, and silenced ones, maybe a stash for your items and overall deeper character and skill customization and possibly some vehicles or something cool. Being in a storm made me feel like there should be natural disasters, such as a tsunami, hurricane, or especially a volcanic eruption! But OVERALL, the number 1 thing that I would like to see ASAP, is more dinosaurs because I feel as if I don't run into as many dinosaurs as I normally would like to. Plus that there is literally 5 dinosaurs right now, the T-rex,velociraptor,Utahraptor,triceratops and the Quetzalcoatlus. You should add more flying reptiles and aquatic dino's such as the Spinosaurus, and maybe the Crocodile. I realize that you can only place dino's that are in the same time era but I have some suggestions for some must have's. The Pachycephalosaurus, Ankylosaurus, Stegasaurus, Brontosaurus and Pentaceratops. A few more random ones I would like are The Giant Sloth, Allosaurus, Iguanodon, Pachyrhinosaurus, Herrerasaurus, Scipionyx, also some omnivores such as the Abrictosaurus, Avimimus, and the Chirostenotes.\nNow I feel like if you guys updated a lot, and you see what I mean by these paragraphs, that this could be a game everyone loves. But if you flop on it like everyone thinks, someone else will take this awesome idea and make money off it. I'm sure everyone would love if you kept us posted on upcoming updates or things you're working on. Much love and thanks for the read, sincerely an avid fan!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun hunting game, but you end up hunting ammo most of the time. There is a shop, but only accessable on death and it costs a ton so you can only gear up with top tier stuff so often. When things glitch and you get tons of free ammo, it's fun. When you actually have to travel around hunting ammo instead of dinos, it's pretty ♥♥♥♥.

Can't recommend a game that's only fun when it's glitched.

reviewText:
Played this game quite a bit, last session being a 10 hour stream on Twitch.

Enjoying the game a lot so far. The dinosaurs can be really terrifying, especially when you are alone. Once you have a group and some guns (with ammo!) the Velociraptors and Utahraptors become fairly easy to kill.

The Quetz birds are still very dangerous since they grab you and drop you (one of us got 'chain killed' by the birds at least 4-5 times hehe). They are huge and dangerous and really bring an added element of danger (death from above) when you are walking around in open areas.

Of course the T-Rex is death on two legs as always and requires a good group effort to take down (or powerful guns, e.g. .700 rifle or .50 sniper).

For more relaxing and hunting type of gameplay you can focus on the Triceratops, since shooting those means wounding them 10 times out of 10, so you end up having to follow their tracks and blood trails for follow up shots to kill them. They are not dangerous at all (never had one attack me) and the biggest danger hunting those comes from not paying attention to, or attracting due to gunshots, the other dinosaurs.

My two main things that I hope to see improved in the game though:

Better AI and dinosaur movement - they are sometimes a bit robotic, e.g. they run to a spot and then freeze for no reason. This makes it a little easier to kill them, but they are still lethal and can do lots of damage to you, especially if you play solo.

More dinosaurs! - Sure there are 5 ingame now, but I am hoping they will add more dinosaurs. I'd like to see a mix of both docile (like the triceratops) and lethal ones.. both large ones and small ones!

Overall though the game is really fun, especially if you play with friends!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Nice graphics, great sound effects, and an interesting tracking system. Shooting mechanics on this game are realistic, but I think the bow and arrows need a little bit of work.

The gameplay is pretty immersive. I nearly ♥♥♥♥♥♥ my pants after a T-rex quickly snuck up on me while I was trying to get loot from a storage crate. I really enjoyed the time I've spent on this game so far. I've been waiting for years for another game like carnivores (except improved greatly), and I really think this game has the potential to fill the gap in the market for a quality dinosaur survival/hunting game.

Since this is an early release, there aren't many dinosaurs to hunt, and there are just a few graphic glitches that I've come across. A save option (or a hive that saves your gear/progress like DayZ) would be great, and I'm sure they'll implement something like that in the time to come.

I hope this game gets more publicity and traction in the gaming community because this game would be very fun to play with/against larger groups of people.

reviewText: Was a good game prerelease.  However with the the totally unrealistic  balance of predators to prey no claims of a serious hunting simulation can be made.    Most of the animals should be herbivores not carnivores.  I knew thay intended a March release but five total species with four of them being predators is just wrong.  Also the developers just squashed any hope of any further development.  In their latest post they said they would only be working on patches and would not be devloping it any further.   (See there April 1st post release round up).  In addition they said that the current sorry state of the game exceeds their original intentions.\nI have backed several early access games and this is about the worst. (The Stomping Land takes that honor).  They took advantage of peoples assumption that early access games are to help fund devlopment.  They went from early access to release in six months.  This was basically having people pay to beta test.  This is a common complaint about early access but I have never seen one so blatant about it.
