reviewText: After having tried out The Hunter, and finding it to be wholly unsatisfying with its pay to hunt system, I took to The Hunter: Primal. At first the game seemed to have its core player in mind with prommosed content and no in game puchases to speak of. Throughout its development however, the development team has done little to stay ahead of the abusive douping and scripting undertaken by a portion of the player base. These issues made it impossible to play on public servers whereupon the need for a private lobby was pramount to actually enjoying the game with friends.\n\nIt saddens me that this game is being, for all intensive purposes, abandoned shortly after its official release. I hope that this does not become a trend in game development where the content is shunted after its faithful beta supporters were made so many promisses.

reviewText:
This game has great potential.

However, at this stage, the game still requires a lot of work like a more fair gameplay experience (the game is extremely hard to play untill you get lucky and find some valuable loot). Also, the hunter primal gets extremely boring 99% of the time; walking around for hours and not finding a single weapon to hunt some dinosaurs (BASICALLY TO PLAY THE GAME).

If you have patience, get the game because it can get a little fun after some time. If not, then avoid this game at all costs!!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun hunting game, but you end up hunting ammo most of the time. There is a shop, but only accessable on death and it costs a ton so you can only gear up with top tier stuff so often. When things glitch and you get tons of free ammo, it's fun. When you actually have to travel around hunting ammo instead of dinos, it's pretty ♥♥♥♥.

Can't recommend a game that's only fun when it's glitched.

reviewText:
decent game if you like dinos. wish it was more on the hunting side than survival but oh well. i honestly havnt ran into too many bugs since it released. has enough content imo. if they added too many more dinos it would be to crowded.

i do see people wanting more herbivores but why add something that you will have to run down to kill unless you have a high end gun? the game seems fairly balanced atm with what dinosaurs are here already. the only few cons i can see with this game is the running and massive land mass thats here,its pretty annoying and takes forever to get anywhere.

the 2nd problem i have is how they did the store/weapon unlocks. you start at level 1 and for each dinosaur you kill you get  EXP and some money. the first gun is unlocked at level 10 and every 10 levels after that you pretty much unlock guns/ammo/clothing. anyways when you buy these items they are put inot the supply drop as you spawn but heres the problem you start with a machete and you have to find weapons or manage to find and kill velociraptors with that and then you could always buy the bow/arrows for semi larger stuff.

anyways you have to kill stuff to maintain a decent inventory because if you blow your cash and go out and die then you can try to recalim what was lost but if you cant then you wasted money. its a decent system IF they would have allowed you to actually start off with a gun/ammo and have fun hunting, but alas i suppose thats why its more a survival game" than a hunter game.

im only recommneding this because of dinosaurs and its a fun game to kill time in. and they did a decent job with this as opposed to that terrible other hunting game they put out lol."

reviewText:
I do not recommend getting this game as it is now. However if its on sale definatly check it out and to support the developers. (Its also a lot better to play with friends)

The only thing I really dont get is that this is a full release, but really it should still be in Alpha.
Alpha is mainly the additions being added to the game.
Beta is mainly the fixing of bugs and glitchs from those additions, etc.
It seems like the devs are doing both of these at the same time in a scatterbrain sorta way.

Pros:

-Open world
-Great Graphics
-Amazing Sounds
-Easy Controls
-Nice dino animations (can be a little glitchy at times)
-Co-op and multiplayer is fun and smooth (depending on host)

Cons:

-Many bugs
-Can't swim
-Cant climb/Jump
-Cant build/place anything, not even traps
-Only 5 dino types in the world
-Weight system is very limited (leaning more towards realism)

As for the content in the game so far, its quite playable but limited in the variety of dinos to hunt.
there are lots of different biomes" and areas to explore in the world.

I would love to see more herbivores added as there is only one.
The ratio is 4:1 (5:1 counting pvp) so be very cautious this is a survival game that relays on your senses and judgement for life or death.

Tip:
If its storming out
date:
wait it out. A T-Rex came charging at me full speed and I couldn't react becuase visability was so low. Nearly had a heart attack.

Verdict 6.5/10
Playble
recommended: fun online and rewarding (when you finally get that T-rex down)"

reviewText:
theHunter: Primal, Hunt - Explore - Survive The most realistic prehistoric survival game ever created. Featuring a huge Cretaceous environment populated by horrifying dinosaur all-stars, such as T-Rex, Triceratops, Utahraptor, Velociraptor and Quetzalcoatlus. God-Everythings out to kill you. I loved this game. It's a bit xpensive but after you play 1 game with an experienced player (Always feel welcome to drop into one of my games) an you learn how to play, you begin to love the game.

I give theHunter: Primal
10/10
